revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-04-29 14:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/291_enforce_flavors_migrated.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_sqlalchemy_migration.py'], 'message': 'Wedge DB migrations if flavor migrations are not complete

In Kilo, we moved per-instance flavor information from sysmeta to a new
location. We have a lot of compatibity code as a result, which we want
to drop ASAP. In order to do that, we need to be sure that nobody can run
the post-drop code with unmigrated instances. This adds a new DB migration
that just does a sanity check and blocks moving forward if any unmigrated
instances are found.

NOTE: This does not operate on deleted instances, which matches the
behavior of the nova-manage command to push migrations.

Depends-On: Ib38f4bdb2b8e478973e0e5aaaeb4a25771af720e
Change-Id: Ide5492b8b52dec665088d7bca78c386418eba0fe
'}]
commit_message:
Wedge DB migrations if flavor migrations are not complete

In Kilo, we moved per-instance flavor information from sysmeta to a new
location. We have a lot of compatibity code as a result, which we want
to drop ASAP. In order to do that, we need to be sure that nobody can run
the post-drop code with unmigrated instances. This adds a new DB migration
that just does a sanity check and blocks moving forward if any unmigrated
instances are found.

NOTE: This does not operate on deleted instances, which matches the
behavior of the nova-manage command to push migrations.

Depends-On: Ib38f4bdb2b8e478973e0e5aaaeb4a25771af720e
Change-Id: Ide5492b8b52dec665088d7bca78c386418eba0fe

commit_message:
Get the 'consumer' in a correct way for retyping with qos-specs

The qos specs returned from the database does not contain the
property "qos-specs". Intead, the property "consumer" can be accessed
directly.

Change-Id: I3fe57e5cc20a97d32c8b8c6089ab1e812257da45
closes-bug: #1389519
(cherry picked from commit ef59e5f8c42365f7d55ea84d4afb364241a388c3)

commit_message:
Add icmpv6 to sg_supported_protocols

support using icmpv6 (protocol num 58) in the protocol option, when creating
a security group rule.At this time, port_range_min/port_range_max represent
icmpv6 type/code, and you can use only port_range_min to specify just one type.
eg:neutron security-group-rule-create --direction ingress \
   --ethertype ipv6 --protocol icmpv6 --port-range-min 134 SECURITY_GROUP

ApiImpact
DocImpact
Partial-Bug:#1427973
Change-Id: Ide4f7476cdb8a4f04f72983917ce7dbfc7be90a5

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-27 14:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_md_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/utils/md_utils.py'], 'message': '[IBP] Fix ValueError while parsing: mdadm --detail

fuel-agent doesn't expect header from 'mdadm --detail' output where
'State' is not present.

fuel-agent should expect 2 types of headers:
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice State\n" (already supported)
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice\n" - addressed by this patch.

This patch is required to let fuel-agent consume both types of headers.

Additionally fuel-agent will start to log 'mdadm --detail' output to ease
troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ie20db2c14bdc5669566a140a34d63d28c6115d11
Closes-Bug: #1446186
'}]
commit_message:
[IBP] Fix ValueError while parsing: mdadm --detail

fuel-agent doesn't expect header from 'mdadm --detail' output where
'State' is not present.

fuel-agent should expect 2 types of headers:
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice State\n" (already supported)
" Number Major Minor RaidDevice\n" - addressed by this patch.

This patch is required to let fuel-agent consume both types of headers.

Additionally fuel-agent will start to log 'mdadm --detail' output to ease
troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ie20db2c14bdc5669566a140a34d63d28c6115d11
Closes-Bug: #1446186

'}]
commit_message:
Add find_bind_ip function

This patch adds a custom Puppet function called find_bind_ip.
This function will be used within the TripleO puppet implementation
to help obtain the correct local bind IP for a provided subnet.

The goal is to better integrate with network architectures which
isolate traffic on different networks.

Change-Id: Ifd448ae0909aee538a7068d0b8ac6441a9e51872

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 425, 'name': 'Darren Birkett', 'email': 'darren.birkett@gmail.com', 'username': 'darren-birkett'}, {'_account_id': 2799, 'name': 'Andy McCrae', 'email': 'andy.mccrae@googlemail.com', 'username': 'andrew-mccrae'}, {'_account_id': 7219, 'name': 'git-harry', 'email': 'git-harry@live.co.uk', 'username': 'git-harry'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-04-29 20:11:04.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_cinder/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': "Update cinder.conf for cinder-backup

This change updates the way we write cinder.conf when cinder backups
are enabled.  If cinder_service_backup_swift_auth is set to 'per_user',
we do not set any url/user/key/tenant options in the config.  However,
if cinder_service_backup_swift_auth is set to 'single_user' then all
auth-related options will be written.  Some additional variables were
added to allow 'single_user' to work properly.

Note that backup_swift_url is actually the swift storage URL if using
'per_user', or your auth URL if using 'single_user'.

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: Ia9d2e140d629b1f7b4c668d2f6041f3c440ab826
"}]
commit_message:
Update cinder.conf for cinder-backup

This change updates the way we write cinder.conf when cinder backups
are enabled.  If cinder_service_backup_swift_auth is set to 'per_user',
we do not set any url/user/key/tenant options in the config.  However,
if cinder_service_backup_swift_auth is set to 'single_user' then all
auth-related options will be written.  Some additional variables were
added to allow 'single_user' to work properly.

Note that backup_swift_url is actually the swift storage URL if using
'per_user', or your auth URL if using 'single_user'.

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: Ia9d2e140d629b1f7b4c668d2f6041f3c440ab826

commit_message:
Force IPv4 settings for APT

* Create /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/05disable-ipv6 and set Acquire::ForceIPv4 "true";
  to disable IPv6 as Ubuntu DNS returns IPv6 sometimes.
* Delete the same part from fuel_agent_ci cloud-init template as it should be
  configured by Orchestrator

Change-Id: I90fe58157c3eac04842102b1cb956bbeb324413a
Closes-Bug: 1450004
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

The pypowervm library recently defaulted the XAG attribute (extended
attributes) to none.  The side effect to this is that the VIOS read is
no longer returning the Shared Ethernet Adapters.

This change updates the parse of the bridge mappings to pass in the

commit_message:
Parse Bridge Mappings to include XAG

The pypowervm library recently defaulted the XAG attribute (extended
attributes) to none.  The side effect to this is that the VIOS read is
no longer returning the Shared Ethernet Adapters.

This change updates the parse of the bridge mappings to pass in the
appropriate XAG to get the proper return data.

It also includes a unit test for the parse_bridge_mappings which had
been missed initially.

Change-Id: Ifb9ce3b9c008cf71715667d22312b8fa6a87304a

commit_message:
Use ipv4 address for connectivity in lb integration test

You can not specify subnet for a server creation. Therefore server
nic would get ip adresses from all subnets. We should pick the
ipv4 address to check connectivity.

Also added change to NovaClientPlugin to provide ipv4 address.

Change-Id: I2eb3bdb359aca0cfaebf0be98db79170c681a078
Closes-Bug: #1450293

commit_message:
Pacemaker fixes for controller add/remove

  a pacemaker service to be started even if
  this service is actually started.

* pcmk_nodes resource to add and remove
  corosync nodes

Change-Id: I97035e633c33f94519b66526268620f9cd6cc958
Closes-Bug: 1394188

commit_message:
RN6.0-updates2: nova boot vm with '--nic'

Adds the Nova-related resolved issue:

commit_message:
RN6.0-updates2 Neutron resolved issues

Adds Neutron-related resolved issues:
-Neutron loses connection to rabbitmq with Errno 32.
-No connectivity to instances in HA neutron env.
-Security group listing operation fails with timeout.
-Neutron server creates more than one port for a VM.
-Incorrect exception reference in ml2 plugin.
-Neutron server consumes redundant resources.
-Neutron port is not found exception.
-Performance improvement of sec groups RPC-related code.
-radvd >= 2.0 blocks router update processing.

Change-Id: Ic84a961ab1dd64024d069fb79efb27a4aa204150

commit_message:
Update ironic config tables for kilo

Updated ironic.headers and regenerated/updated the config tables
for ironic, using stable/kilo branch. Deleted tables that aren't
used by ironic (most likely due to some bug when generating these
with authohelp-wrapper having the venvs of all the OpenStack
projects).

I created and generated the config tables via
 "./autohelp-wrapper -b stable/kilo create ironic" and
 "./autohelp-wrapper -f docbook ironic".

Change-Id: I95644482b107a3f71962bc52618dcd5a6ff597af

L3 service plugin first calls to remove_router_interface from the L2 OVS agent
which delete this port from OVS and then the service plugin calls
to remove the router interface from L3 agent.

Catch the exception thrown on the delete gateway, if its due to device doesn't exists

"}]
commit_message:
Suppress exception when trying to remove non existing device in SNAT redirect

L3 service plugin first calls to remove_router_interface from the L2 OVS agent
which delete this port from OVS and then the service plugin calls
to remove the router interface from L3 agent.

Catch the exception thrown on the delete gateway, if its due to device doesn't exists
ignore the exception

Closes-Bug: #1435012
Change-Id: Ieeaa01e7c0393f5200d1a8d2bbbc16befe7699a2

commit_message:
Honor shared storage on resize revert

This patch improves the logic in resize_revert() to properly honor
shared storage when destroying the unneeded instance.  In the case of
shared storage, the disks need not be destroyed and doing so results in
the inability to start the original instance.

Conflicts is caused by moving tests to /unit directory

Also commit contains squash from fixed implementation of determening
if storage is shared (get from commit fde77d49ff550b73f5f1671edc7366c9b7646200)

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py
        nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Closes-Bug: #1399244
Change-Id: I310f6b62a790e4549a2cf9ff3842655da552177a
(cherry picked from commit eec0937af9d88f3c7ffacf9ce7b8955b2e4be479)

commit_message:
Fix fedora kernel install in ibp mode

Now, when we select Image based provisioning (ibp) and also
select install Fedora kernel it installs old CentOS kernel.

Install both kernels on images and then choose right
kernel (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176864/)

Change-Id: Ib3a269562fb44f65ba1fb59861707e71627d17c8
Partially-closes-bug: #1398643

commit_message:
Fix exec resource ensurability for auxiliary repos

Dependence on part of the files created by the exec
statements in nailgun::auxiliaryrepos was inadequate
to work with patching tests. Now replaced with unless
statements to ensure all files and directories.

Release file is now set to replace => false.

Change-Id: I3fe15130d3c70ab4441b7fe9e3b108f617738cc8
Closes-Bug: #1450124

commit_message:
Load archive_policy named resource metric

If the orm object of a metric is loaded with a resource,
the joinedload of the resource doesn't include the archive_policy.

This change load the archive_policy when we ask for a metric attached
to a resource.

Closes-bug: #1449452
Change-Id: Ic48f43048fe3e14b42b347cf44250183de60f9d8
(cherry picked from commit c3660930ff45fc5175032294836784417f0ea306)

subject: ceilometer: Use http session in dispatcher
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 14:00:32.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/ceilometer/dispatcher.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_ceilometer_dispatcher.py'], 'message': 'ceilometer: Use http session in dispatcher

The ceilometer dipatcher needs to do between 2 to 5 http requests
for each samples. Current it use the basic API of the python-requests
library, that creates 1 tcp connections for each http requests.
Connections are pooled by default (10 simultaneous connections) and
a error is raised when the pool is exhausted.

This change move to the session API of python-requests to
creates only one tcp connection per ceilometer-collector workers,
and block when the pool exhausts.

Change-Id: I8255622cf57082785b48754d9e506413ee9122a7
(cherry picked from commit 40bea729120b536aaff52019189dd8cc48d46f2e)
'}]
commit_message:
ceilometer: Use http session in dispatcher

The ceilometer dipatcher needs to do between 2 to 5 http requests
for each samples. Current it use the basic API of the python-requests
library, that creates 1 tcp connections for each http requests.
Connections are pooled by default (10 simultaneous connections) and
a error is raised when the pool is exhausted.

This change move to the session API of python-requests to
creates only one tcp connection per ceilometer-collector workers,
and block when the pool exhausts.

Change-Id: I8255622cf57082785b48754d9e506413ee9122a7
(cherry picked from commit 40bea729120b536aaff52019189dd8cc48d46f2e)

The newer hacking version for Juno introduces a newer version of

commit_message:
Switch to Hacking 0.9.x

The newer hacking version for Juno introduces a newer version of
pep8 checks that check for:

 E265 block comment should start with '# '
 E251 unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter equals

and has a few bugfixes over the previous version, so it catches
more pep8 violations. Those occurrences are fixed alongway.

The following new Hacking 0.9x check was fixed alongway:

* Group third-party and site-packages in one group of imports

The following new Hacking 0.9x checks are blacklisted for now:

 H305  imports not grouped correctly
 H405  multi line docstring summary not separated with an empty line
 H904  Wrap long lines in parentheses instead of a backslash

They can be cleaned up in later commits.

Change-Id: Icc2f8fc868aad2ea8eaca1fe5a6175aa4a950a23

commit_message:
Installation version info added into stats protocol

For handling filtration of data on the collector side we introduce
installation_version into stats saving protocol. Installation version
is dictionary with 'release' and 'build_id' values.
Function fuel_release_info moved from installation_info to statistics.utils.

Change-Id: I1259aaae86464aab5923a0caa36c75cbe99c3e58
Partial-Bug: #1443347

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-04-24 12:23:33.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py'], 'message': 'Wait for complete deletion of volume snapshot before deleting volume

In file tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py there 
is a method for creating snapshots from volumes. The method 
is _create_snapshot_from_volume(...). The thing is that method
_create_snapshot_from_volume(...) uses method 
self.addCleanup_with_wait(...) (that does not wait for complete 
resource deletion right after sending the request to delete the 
resource) in order to delete created volume snapshot after the test
finished. But volumes cannot be deleted when there are outstanding 
snapshots. Therefore we should wait for complete deletion of 
the volume snapshot before we start to delete the volume.

Closes-Bug: #1441563

Change-Id: I11207c3ac9296389c5e195b2296fc47e65a7486c
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for complete deletion of volume snapshot before deleting volume

In file tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py there 
is a method for creating snapshots from volumes. The method 
is _create_snapshot_from_volume(...). The thing is that method
_create_snapshot_from_volume(...) uses method 
self.addCleanup_with_wait(...) (that does not wait for complete 
resource deletion right after sending the request to delete the 
resource) in order to delete created volume snapshot after the test
finished. But volumes cannot be deleted when there are outstanding 
snapshots. Therefore we should wait for complete deletion of 
the volume snapshot before we start to delete the volume.

Closes-Bug: #1441563

subject: Make mongodb retrieve conf from proper file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-27 21:08:53.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Make mongodb retrieve conf from proper file

Currently mongodb is reading file from /etc/mongodb.conf (default when
package was coming from OSP), a recent change in EPEL mongodb package made
it supersed the version from OSP. In this version, it reads its default
configuration from /etc/mongod.conf.

Hence current changes happen in a configuration file that is not read
and his thus irrelevant.

Change-Id: I644d7f7a65ba8721e606eb869efede53bdeca7d7
'}]
commit_message:
Make mongodb retrieve conf from proper file

Currently mongodb is reading file from /etc/mongodb.conf (default when
package was coming from OSP), a recent change in EPEL mongodb package made
it supersed the version from OSP. In this version, it reads its default
configuration from /etc/mongod.conf.

Hence current changes happen in a configuration file that is not read
and his thus irrelevant.

Change-Id: I644d7f7a65ba8721e606eb869efede53bdeca7d7

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-21 13:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py', 'test/unit/common/test_bufferedhttp.py', 'swift/common/bufferedhttp.py'], 'message': 'Fix tempauth acl checks when simplejson has no speedups

As documented in linked bug report, tempauth unit tests
were seen to fail on a system where simplejson was
installed but without the speedups extension. This
is because the tempauth account acl validation checks
that values are type str, but without the speedups
extension the json parser is returning unicode objects.

Fix is to have the acl validator tolerate those objects
being unicode or str.

Also change common/bufferedhttp.py to coerce ring device
to type str when constructing a path, in order to avoid
a UnicodeDecodeError when httplib sends a message that
has non-ascii header values.

Change-Id: I01524282cbaa25dc4b6dfa09f3f4723516cdba99
Closes-Bug: 1425776
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tempauth acl checks when simplejson has no speedups

As documented in linked bug report, tempauth unit tests
were seen to fail on a system where simplejson was
installed but without the speedups extension. This
is because the tempauth account acl validation checks
that values are type str, but without the speedups
extension the json parser is returning unicode objects.

Fix is to have the acl validator tolerate those objects
being unicode or str.

Also change common/bufferedhttp.py to coerce ring device
to type str when constructing a path, in order to avoid
a UnicodeDecodeError when httplib sends a message that
has non-ascii header values.

Change-Id: I01524282cbaa25dc4b6dfa09f3f4723516cdba99
Closes-Bug: 1425776

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 21:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/openstack/common/log.py', 'muranodashboard/openstack/common/_i18n.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Icbd2ae016553b5e5c886205e87acf38f3ccec550
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Icbd2ae016553b5e5c886205e87acf38f3ccec550

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-22 08:43:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Recover from POWERING-* state on compute manager start-up

If a compute manager is stopped / fails during POWERING-ON or
POWERING-OFF operations then the instance will be left stuck in
a transitional task_state.

This change handles both these states by simply either retriggering
the power on or power off request on start-up of the compute manager.
If the operation had previously completed then retrying will
essentially be a no-op so it is safe to handle instances in this
state in this way.

Closes bug: #1304333

(cherry picked from commit 8f7056f48c115ee0939c76ce08531dab0f14e354)
Change-Id: I262be6b13a764bc1355be34cdc0180e8e87f260b
'}]
commit_message:
Recover from POWERING-* state on compute manager start-up

If a compute manager is stopped / fails during POWERING-ON or
POWERING-OFF operations then the instance will be left stuck in
a transitional task_state.

This change handles both these states by simply either retriggering
the power on or power off request on start-up of the compute manager.
If the operation had previously completed then retrying will
essentially be a no-op so it is safe to handle instances in this
state in this way.

Closes bug: #1304333

(cherry picked from commit 8f7056f48c115ee0939c76ce08531dab0f14e354)
Change-Id: I262be6b13a764bc1355be34cdc0180e8e87f260b

commit_message:
Programmable cloud edge networks

Defines an API to allow external network controllers managing
networking beyond the cloud to pass traffic into specified Neutron
networks within the cloud.  Said networks may be as simple as
switch ports or as complex as encapsulations and overlays.

Change-Id: If3374f2b4da4a681fd49ac41f60fc25d4905d3c3

We had a staging tests failure (see the bug referenced below) which was
caused by 3 of 5 nodes not comming up in time. Right now we don't know
how much time it takes 5 nodes to come up normally. Maybe 10 minutes is
barely enough and we just need to increase timeout? We will not know that
for sure until we log the time and see how much time it takes on average.
This change introduces such logging.

Change-Id: I342f6997f74d2d42dcf772fb5e2f597122d54a94
Related-Bug: #1435837
"}]
commit_message:
Log waiting time for node bootstrapping

We had a staging tests failure (see the bug referenced below) which was
caused by 3 of 5 nodes not comming up in time. Right now we don't know
how much time it takes 5 nodes to come up normally. Maybe 10 minutes is
barely enough and we just need to increase timeout? We will not know that
for sure until we log the time and see how much time it takes on average.
This change introduces such logging.

Change-Id: I342f6997f74d2d42dcf772fb5e2f597122d54a94
Related-Bug: #1435837

subject: Use openstack common util method to find name-or-id resource
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-30 02:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/openstack/common/uuidutils.py', 'keystoneclient/openstack/common/apiclient/utils.py', 'keystoneclient/utils.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'keystoneclient/v2_0/shell.py'], 'message': 'Use openstack common util method to find name-or-id resource

Currently, the keystone commands support name-or-id, like this:
    keystone --debug user-role-list --tenant-id admin
But, if we specified tenant_id of "--tenant-id" parameter of above
command, keystoneclient will still try to get the tenant at first,
that is inefficient, it is better to directly use the tenant_id to
get user-role relationship firstly. This flaw can be find by
specifying "--debug" option with above command. The openstack common
util method "find_resource" has optimized that, this change switch
keystonclient to use it.

Change-Id: I0264567320ab8f77bb832c5f8613361069172c2d
Closes-Bug: #1450276
'}]
commit_message:
Use openstack common util method to find name-or-id resource

Currently, the keystone commands support name-or-id, like this:
    keystone --debug user-role-list --tenant-id admin
But, if we specified tenant_id of "--tenant-id" parameter of above
command, keystoneclient will still try to get the tenant at first,
that is inefficient, it is better to directly use the tenant_id to
get user-role relationship firstly. This flaw can be find by
specifying "--debug" option with above command. The openstack common
util method "find_resource" has optimized that, this change switch
keystonclient to use it.

Change-Id: I0264567320ab8f77bb832c5f8613361069172c2d
Closes-Bug: #1450276

commit_message:
Allow deployer to choose Ceilometer backend

Ceilometer can use different backends. A recent change moved backend
support for Ceilometer from MySQL to MongoDB. This commit introduce a
greater flexibility, letting the deployer choose wheter MySQL or MongoDB
should be used as a backend for Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I0d5bfb0763cbcee234df7ab13574d866743d5ddf

The os-baremetal-nodes extension currently relies on the presence
of specific properties on the Ironic nodes.  This can result in
KeyError exceptions if there are nodes in the Ironic inventory
without these (specifically: cpus, memory_mb, local_gb).  This
updates the extension to avoid the KeyError. This is consistent
with how the Ironic driver calculates resources from nodes.  That
is, nodes that are missing a specific property are simply considered
to provide 0 resources of that type.

This is a backport of commit 7b0721f5997c86e0ef3c51c4a60a8f667c93812a

Change-Id: I1c30d5100b01a3e8cbce5185b5adeb8b5ce48aa0
Closes-Bug: #1423427
'}]
commit_message:
Fix BM nodes extension to deal with missing node properties

The os-baremetal-nodes extension currently relies on the presence
of specific properties on the Ironic nodes.  This can result in
KeyError exceptions if there are nodes in the Ironic inventory
without these (specifically: cpus, memory_mb, local_gb).  This
updates the extension to avoid the KeyError. This is consistent
with how the Ironic driver calculates resources from nodes.  That
is, nodes that are missing a specific property are simply considered
to provide 0 resources of that type.

This is a backport of commit 7b0721f5997c86e0ef3c51c4a60a8f667c93812a

Change-Id: I1c30d5100b01a3e8cbce5185b5adeb8b5ce48aa0
Closes-Bug: #1423427

commit_message:
Add partial stateful-only backup of Fuel

Defaults now to stateful-only backup.
New option dockerctl backup [path] --full
will include the following:
 * /etc/puppet
 * /var/www/nailgun
 * docker container backups

dockerctl restore now defaults to stateful-only
restore. --full option is necessary to restore
Docker containers. All system directory backups,
however, will be restored regardless of --full
option.

System directory backup now pauses any running
containers before packing files to minimize
inconsistencies.

Added postgres DB dump to backup, but not restore
because in-place restore is adequte, but DB dumps
can be useful for serious troubleshooting if a
need arises.

blueprint master-stateful-only-backup

Change-Id: Ifc1d086a2eb15c0ea03d3ffdd2795a1f99d1c092
Doc-Impact: ops

commit_message:
Switch FQDN/hostname entries in Heat hosts

This is needed so that `facter fqdn` and `hostname -f` print the same
result which is needed for `puppet apply` to run.

commit_message:
Adding script for retrieving OpenStack action list

 * It is simple CLI tool.
 * Script now works fine for: Nova, Keystone,
   Glance, Heat and Cinder.
 * in case of Keystone, user must provide full
   auth_info and use v3 auth_url.

TODO:
 * Think on optimal way to do it for neutron.

Change-Id: I3ed144bd84a6fbd24dc518c17cd3962bf3af4caa
(cherry picked from commit ec2935f7edc49ddc5f7cf7630c75e1a9ba4dbe7e)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-27 14:51:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "Forbid booting of QCOW2 images with virtual_size > root_gb

Currently, it's possible to boot an instance from a QCOW2 image,
which has virtual_size bigger than one allowed by the given flavor
(root_gb).

The issue is caused by two different problems in the code:

1) typo in get_disk_size() has made it always return None and
   effectively disabled verify_base_size() checks

2) Rbd image backend skips the verify_base_size() step for
   'cached' images (the one with base files), so it is possible to
   boot an instance using a larger flavor once and then use smaller
   flavors to boot the same image, even if allowed root_gb size is
   smaller than the image virtual size

Closes-Bug: #1429093

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py

Change-Id: I383130e5f8cc288f4b428ed43fe4d3aba7169473
(cherry picked from commit c1f9ed27af64e6893d9d0153a964df5aba99b8f0)
"}]
commit_message:
Forbid booting of QCOW2 images with virtual_size > root_gb

Currently, it's possible to boot an instance from a QCOW2 image,
which has virtual_size bigger than one allowed by the given flavor
(root_gb).

The issue is caused by two different problems in the code:

1) typo in get_disk_size() has made it always return None and
   effectively disabled verify_base_size() checks

2) Rbd image backend skips the verify_base_size() step for
   'cached' images (the one with base files), so it is possible to
   boot an instance using a larger flavor once and then use smaller
   flavors to boot the same image, even if allowed root_gb size is
   smaller than the image virtual size

Closes-Bug: #1429093

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py

Change-Id: I383130e5f8cc288f4b428ed43fe4d3aba7169473
(cherry picked from commit c1f9ed27af64e6893d9d0153a964df5aba99b8f0)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-29 18:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-containers-create.yml', 'scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'playbooks/vars/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml', 'playbooks/vars/repo_packages/openstack_other.yml'], 'message': 'Unblock master gating

Most of master is transitioning to the liberty cycle, to allow us
to continue gating the service install versions is being set back
to the head of the stable/kilo branch. This should be updated once
all upstream OpenStack projects fully transition to Liberty.

This adds a wait condition when creating the containers to ensure
that the containers are created correctly and that ssh is available
within them before actually continuing with the installation process

This change forces the apt mirrors to use a set that is known good.
The previous changes to set the mirrors to the same as what was
already on the host has proven itself to be a greater issue by not
using a set that is known to be in good working order.

Change-Id: I1872a32b53b9caecb8ac0803db304fa0ee254475
Closes-Bug: 1441148
'}]
commit_message:
Unblock master gating

Most of master is transitioning to the liberty cycle, to allow us
to continue gating the service install versions is being set back
to the head of the stable/kilo branch. This should be updated once
all upstream OpenStack projects fully transition to Liberty.

This adds a wait condition when creating the containers to ensure
that the containers are created correctly and that ssh is available
within them before actually continuing with the installation process

This change forces the apt mirrors to use a set that is known good.
The previous changes to set the mirrors to the same as what was
already on the host has proven itself to be a greater issue by not
using a set that is known to be in good working order.

Change-Id: I1872a32b53b9caecb8ac0803db304fa0ee254475
Closes-Bug: 1441148

commit_message:
Use separate toctree directives for user vs admin

Including a document in a toctree and then excluding it with a meta
condition confuses the next/previous link generation. Use completely
separate toctrees instead.

Change-Id: I96c15ad37f0bd89e40d2351ffe85aa9d15ab1aff

commit_message:
Provide the RabbitMQ OCF backport guide

This update to the ops guide describes how
to backport the RabbitMQ OCF script from the
6.0.x / 5.1.x trunc branches to the existing
Fuel 6.0/5.1 installations

Add details about managing OpenStack services
in ops guide as it was missing.

Closes-bug: #1440018

Change-Id: Ia05b5d01fee4e933f64d6cd5ad0d4c28622cc54e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Fix get_ml2_port_bond_data() return code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 15:33:48.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/neutron/services/l3/l3_controller_plugin.py'], 'message': "Fix get_ml2_port_bond_data() return code

The method returned {None} which is a set containing None.
I assume the correct result was just returning None

Also the calling method didn't properly handle the case where None (or
the original set) were returned.

Change-Id: I109e4f9c45cba1884be8fd7fca0c3a38d4802f16
Signed-off-by: Saggi Mizrahi <saggi.mizrahi@huawei.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get_ml2_port_bond_data() return code

The method returned {None} which is a set containing None.
I assume the correct result was just returning None

Also the calling method didn't properly handle the case where None (or
the original set) were returned.

Change-Id: I109e4f9c45cba1884be8fd7fca0c3a38d4802f16
Signed-off-by: Saggi Mizrahi <saggi.mizrahi@huawei.com>

commit_message:

The error message is printed for every none router port
but VM ports are also synced.
move the printing to the correct place and change severity
to info

This massively trims down the network api smoke tests to remove all
tests which require an optional extension from the tag, and pair down
what's left to a set of CRUD type tests for most of the major
resources. Additional tests for those resources which tested either
edge conditions, extra attributions, or field filtering are dropped

Change-Id: Ia3472da9b0ef3103560ca23b5736dc6b492b1860

commit_message:
trim network smoke tests

This massively trims down the network api smoke tests to remove all
tests which require an optional extension from the tag, and pair down
what's left to a set of CRUD type tests for most of the major
resources. Additional tests for those resources which tested either
edge conditions, extra attributions, or field filtering are dropped
from the smoke tag as well.

Change-Id: Ia3472da9b0ef3103560ca23b5736dc6b492b1860

commit_message:
remove smoke tag from admin tests

remove the smoke test from the admin tests. The smoke tag should
really be a small set of positive user level tests of function, admin
only tests really don't fit in this category.

Change-Id: I940324172405865c4c56c4c1fd1b49819be5ef0e

commit_message:
not all scenario tests should be in smoke

The decision to include all of scenario by default makes for an
extremely heavy test of tests in smoke, we should instead only include
specific scenario tests that expose some basic sanity
checking. Advanced scenario tests should be dropped from this list.

This change means we no longer have to exclude 'slow' tests, as we'll
just tag the right tests with smoke.

Change-Id: I34aa8aa9274e02bb68f62863d64c47ba9916f2e4

commit_message:
Allow plugin to specify router_id

It is useful to allow the backend to specify the uuid that we want neutron to
use. We currently do this same thing for networks. This patch enables the same
behavior for routers as well.

Change-Id: If675dfd2997217886976301270ef5f773ffa7a13

revisions:

This commit adds the configuration for the cinder-backup service to the
cinder.conf template (specifically at this time only support for the
swift driver is included)

Additionally, plays are added to start the cinder-backup service on the
cinder-volumes containers (this behaviour mirrors what is currently in
master).

Whilst not a cherry-pick, this work is modelled on similar work in

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: I6f3353210277c344c191f226c2e8d11bf5822419

commit_message:
Add ability to configure cinder backups

This commit adds the configuration for the cinder-backup service to the
cinder.conf template (specifically at this time only support for the
swift driver is included)

Additionally, plays are added to start the cinder-backup service on the
cinder-volumes containers (this behaviour mirrors what is currently in
master).

Whilst not a cherry-pick, this work is modelled on similar work in
master

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: I6f3353210277c344c191f226c2e8d11bf5822419

subject: Add NoDiskSpaceException
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-27 09:23:34.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/tests/test_exceptions.py', 'oslo_vmware/exceptions.py', 'oslo_vmware/tests/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Add NoDiskSpaceException

vSphere APIs such as ExtendVirtualDisk_Task, CopyVirtualDisk_Task
throw NoDiskSpace fault when there is insufficient datastore
space. Currently, VMwareDriverException is thrown by oslo.vmware in
response to NoDiskSpace VIM fault. This patch adds a new exception
class corresponding to NoDiskSpace fault.

Change-Id: I50c5a93aae7fa2b5ad29951eec4d5a07e4f02045
'}]
commit_message:
Add NoDiskSpaceException

vSphere APIs such as ExtendVirtualDisk_Task, CopyVirtualDisk_Task
throw NoDiskSpace fault when there is insufficient datastore
space. Currently, VMwareDriverException is thrown by oslo.vmware in
response to NoDiskSpace VIM fault. This patch adds a new exception
class corresponding to NoDiskSpace fault.

Change-Id: I50c5a93aae7fa2b5ad29951eec4d5a07e4f02045

subject: Fixes wrong folder for listing tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-27 13:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf'], 'message': "Fixes wrong folder for listing tests

oslo.serialization had ./tests in its .testr.conf instead of just .,
which as a result didn't run the tests inside ./oslo_serialization.
This is quite bad, because what's important right now is the new
tests in the non-namespace folder. This patch fixes this, and allow
to run all tests.

Change-Id: Ic8d7409b214864d6350c76fd6d86c430a7380e8c
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes wrong folder for listing tests

oslo.serialization had ./tests in its .testr.conf instead of just .,
which as a result didn't run the tests inside ./oslo_serialization.
This is quite bad, because what's important right now is the new
tests in the non-namespace folder. This patch fixes this, and allow
to run all tests.

Change-Id: Ic8d7409b214864d6350c76fd6d86c430a7380e8c

subject: Fix snapshot image/backup residue in backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-27 07:08:25.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/cinder/volume.py', 'heat/tests/test_server.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Fix snapshot image/backup residue in backend

Set resource data 'snapshot_image_id' of server and
'backup_id' of volume immediately after creating the
image and backup while snapshoting. Otherwise there
will image/backup residue in backend.

Change-Id: Id7441f0c9d537b417488c2857019802872239b2e
Closes-Bug: #1448842
"}]
commit_message:
Fix snapshot image/backup residue in backend

Set resource data 'snapshot_image_id' of server and
'backup_id' of volume immediately after creating the
image and backup while snapshoting. Otherwise there
will image/backup residue in backend.

Change-Id: Id7441f0c9d537b417488c2857019802872239b2e
Closes-Bug: #1448842

commit_message:
Update secgroup API for new get/list/search API

Security group API now conforms to the new get/list/search
interface. Instead of a Nova object being returned, we now return
a dict (or list of dicts).

Change-Id: I0b84ef6065101948ffb2a0f56235bda7a071ad17

subject: Update flavor API for new get/list/search API
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-24 13:34:22.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Update flavor API for new get/list/search API

The flavor API methods now support the get/list/search style interface.
This required changing the format of the flavor list from a list of
{flavor_id: flavor_obj} dicts to a list of converted flavor dicts.

Change-Id: I593493c16f441470e9f210592c4baf2fa81664b5
'}]
commit_message:
Update flavor API for new get/list/search API

The flavor API methods now support the get/list/search style interface.
This required changing the format of the flavor list from a list of
{flavor_id: flavor_obj} dicts to a list of converted flavor dicts.

commit_message:
Support to generate hot template based on resource type

Currently heat supports to create CFN template based on
the given resource type. And this patch adds an option
to allow user to specify template type to generate(support
HOT template at the same time).

blueprint support-to-generate-hot-templates

Change-Id: I55cfb9b0f87e638350f2f6367fb399d772fff7e1

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 19:16:30.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/openstack/common/policy.py', 'openstack_dashboard/openstack/common/log.py', 'openstack_dashboard/openstack/common/_i18n.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5da7ca7a8a909eb12a4417e7d5f5b6bd33da4de8
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5da7ca7a8a909eb12a4417e7d5f5b6bd33da4de8

commit_message:
Fix scheduling notifications handler: InstanceScheduled

Currently, the InstanceScheduled class cannot handle the instance
scheduling notifications from nova with the current format. This
change fix the issue.

Change-Id: I0e3df13ba6ac5ddb779dd6e683bbf9160d123481
Closes-Bug: #1386178

subject: Signaling SoftwareDeployment resources via Swift
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-30 01:48:34.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/software-config-swift-signal.rst'], 'message': 'Signaling SoftwareDeployment resources via Swift

Currently the only option for signaling a deployment resource requires making
an authenticated API request to heat. A SoftwareDeployment resource
signal_transport: TEMP_URL_POLL will allow unauthenticated signaling using a
similar approach to OS::Heat::SwiftSignal.

Change-Id: I0847474a28656834685975a1fbb31f455a54ae25
'}]
commit_message:
Signaling SoftwareDeployment resources via Swift

Currently the only option for signaling a deployment resource requires making
an authenticated API request to heat. A SoftwareDeployment resource
signal_transport: TEMP_URL_POLL will allow unauthenticated signaling using a
similar approach to OS::Heat::SwiftSignal.

Change-Id: I0847474a28656834685975a1fbb31f455a54ae25

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-24 20:53:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py'], 'message': "n-net: turn down log level when vif isn't found in deallocate_fixed_ip

Logstash shows that within 7 days this error shows up over 16,000 times
and 85% of those jobs are successful.

http://goo.gl/mz8ocj

Given bug 968457 was reported in 2012 and nothing has been adjusted
since to address this race, we can assume it's not an error condition
that justifies the ERROR log level, so let's tone it down to INFO.

Related-Bug: #968457

Change-Id: I050a8915349da39530433edaba49c1e781e6d692
"}]
commit_message:
n-net: turn down log level when vif isn't found in deallocate_fixed_ip

Logstash shows that within 7 days this error shows up over 16,000 times
and 85% of those jobs are successful.

http://goo.gl/mz8ocj

Given bug 968457 was reported in 2012 and nothing has been adjusted
since to address this race, we can assume it's not an error condition
that justifies the ERROR log level, so let's tone it down to INFO.

Related-Bug: #968457

Change-Id: I050a8915349da39530433edaba49c1e781e6d692

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-20 22:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3_ext_gw_mode.py', 'neutron/db/l3_gwmode_db.py'], 'message': 'Correct inconsistent enable_snat management

Neutron resets enable_snat attribute when external_gateway_info is
cleared but not when external_gateway_info is only updated which
implies the following sets of actions have different behaviors:

  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub1 --disable-snat
  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub2

enable_snat is False after the last command

  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub1 --disable-snat
  neutron router-gateway-clear router1
  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub2

enable_snat is True after the 2nd command resets the gateway AND
enable_snat.

This change proposes to always reset the attribute enable_snat when
enable_snat is not provided in external_gateway_info on POST/PUT for
consistency.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ibab289936c55b1cf9614b44a4f18f54c959ee9e8
Closes-Bug: #1384146
'}]
commit_message:
Correct inconsistent enable_snat management

Neutron resets enable_snat attribute when external_gateway_info is
cleared but not when external_gateway_info is only updated which
implies the following sets of actions have different behaviors:

  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub1 --disable-snat
  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub2

enable_snat is False after the last command

  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub1 --disable-snat
  neutron router-gateway-clear router1
  neutron router-gateway-set router1 pub2

enable_snat is True after the 2nd command resets the gateway AND
enable_snat.

This change proposes to always reset the attribute enable_snat when
enable_snat is not provided in external_gateway_info on POST/PUT for
consistency.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ibab289936c55b1cf9614b44a4f18f54c959ee9e8
Closes-Bug: #1384146

subject: Fix functional tests to run against live clouds
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-29 01:08:59.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_compute.py', 'shade/tests/functional/util.py'], 'message': 'Fix functional tests to run against live clouds

It's possible a developer may have a test account on a live cloud,
rather than a devstack. To support this, we should not make assumptions
about content put into a cloud by devstack, but should request things we
want - such as "the smallest flavor you have".

Keep the attempt to use the cirros image to continue to support
devstack, but fall back to the first ubuntu image found, since that's
the most likely to be cached on compute hosts on public clouds.

Change-Id: I6f0336d02cf924b3657fdc42bd151d11d5e3a6be
'}]
commit_message:
Fix functional tests to run against live clouds

It's possible a developer may have a test account on a live cloud,
rather than a devstack. To support this, we should not make assumptions
about content put into a cloud by devstack, but should request things we
want - such as "the smallest flavor you have".

Keep the attempt to use the cirros image to continue to support
devstack, but fall back to the first ubuntu image found, since that's
the most likely to be cached on compute hosts on public clouds.

Change-Id: I6f0336d02cf924b3657fdc42bd151d11d5e3a6be

commit_message:
change floatingip_subnet to ListOpt

For deployment, MultiStrOpt is a bit more difficult to deal with than
ListOpt so let's switch floatingip_subnet over to ListOpt while we still
can.

Change-Id: Idc2dc582a80993b9de98785ded31cc90ee44f781
(cherry picked from commit 34c351a62e3e03016534c1707f95c826b390a3c5)

commit_message:
Trigger an action in a software-config component

OS::Heat::SoftwareComponent now allows non-lifecycle configs to be specified.
This feature will make it possible to trigger these configs and monitor their
progress and results.

Specifies: blueprint software-config-trigger
Change-Id: I56180f4a7aaaa5c47508f3133258110f34d129fd

subject: Do not cache unsteady state images
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-28 19:29:38.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Do not cache unsteady state images

States that are expected to change should not be cached, as this will
just prolong any polling loops to detect the changes. This also makes
for less invalidations as we can depend on the fact that the cache will
only ever contain steady states.

Change-Id: Ie241db6311540725d24dcc6328f6f965820baf1b
'}]
commit_message:
Do not cache unsteady state images

States that are expected to change should not be cached, as this will
just prolong any polling loops to detect the changes. This also makes
for less invalidations as we can depend on the fact that the cache will
only ever contain steady states.

Change-Id: Ie241db6311540725d24dcc6328f6f965820baf1b

commit_message:
Preserve file attributes when copying image dirs for build

Add "-a" to preserve file attributes so that unnecessary Docker image
build can be avoided. Otherwise, build-all-docker-images will generate
additional image layer due to timestamp change.

Change-Id: I893fa0637937c521198f50b1bba203a27c9f00a3
Closes-Bug: 1449287

commit_message:
Enfore key sorting for serializers

The sorting of keys is not enforced, which is causing some mismatches
for some strict testing. This patch enforce the sorting of keys when
doing JSON dumps.

Change-Id: I31ce5fa5e753cbf287429ad689752353530a4b4f

subject: Revised metadata support
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-29 10:00:29.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/profiles/os/heat/stack.py', 'senlin/profiles/os/nova/server.py', 'senlin/engine/node.py', 'senlin/profiles/base.py', 'senlin/drivers/openstack/nova_v2.py'], 'message': "Revised metadata support

1) add a metadata entry for all servers created by Senlin, which can be
used later on for scaling filter's purpose, for example. 2) removed the
old 'meta' interface which is being substituted by 'metadata'. 3) Make
profile base capable of doing additional operations when node membership
change. 4) Enable nova server profile to handle the join/leave operation
where metadata is changed.

Change-Id: If8789c8a59c9a04e0342d08d5a79dc289704d735
"}]
commit_message:
Revised metadata support

1) add a metadata entry for all servers created by Senlin, which can be
used later on for scaling filter's purpose, for example. 2) removed the
old 'meta' interface which is being substituted by 'metadata'. 3) Make
profile base capable of doing additional operations when node membership
change. 4) Enable nova server profile to handle the join/leave operation
where metadata is changed.

Change-Id: If8789c8a59c9a04e0342d08d5a79dc289704d735

commit_message:
Apply topology_template to tosca_template

Using TopologyTemplate in tosca_template to replace Input, Output,
NodeTemplates and RelationshipTemplates.
But keeping the functions to allow users to get above resources from
ToscaTemplate.
Modified testing templates with 'topology_template' section.

partially implements: bp tosca-topology-template

Change-Id: If3007c81d51f271a53c9940924f46e79a7648021

commit_message:
Exclude ruby from CentOS repo

Since there are 2 version in repo, ruby should be excluded. That allows
to run 'yum upgrade' or 'yum check-update'
https://review.openstack.org/177251 should be reverted once this patch
getis merged

Closes-Bug: 1448114

revisions:

The POST operations in test_content_types.py assert that the expected_status

commit_message:
Tests assert 200 on POST operations instead of 201

The POST operations in test_content_types.py assert that the expected_status
is a 200, instead of 201. According to the v2.0 API documentation, POST
operations should result in 201 Created.

Related-Bug: #1403509

Change-Id: I8e5775ead1c910dac89622479c239cdd56b93ba0

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-27 14:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Add security group calls missing from latest compute rpc api version bump

The recent compute rpc api version bump missed out on the security group
related calls that are part of the api.

One possible reason is that both compute and security group client side
rpc api:s share a single target, which is of little value and only cause
mistakes like this.

This change eliminates future problems like this by combining them into
one to get a 1:1 relationship between client and server api:s.

Change-Id: I9207592a87fab862c04d210450cbac47af6a3fd7
Closes-Bug: #1448075
'}]
commit_message:
Add security group calls missing from latest compute rpc api version bump

The recent compute rpc api version bump missed out on the security group
related calls that are part of the api.

One possible reason is that both compute and security group client side
rpc api:s share a single target, which is of little value and only cause
mistakes like this.

This change eliminates future problems like this by combining them into
one to get a 1:1 relationship between client and server api:s.

Change-Id: I9207592a87fab862c04d210450cbac47af6a3fd7
Closes-Bug: #1448075

revisions:

These are ubuntu-isms that do not exist on debian mirrors and cause
builds to break if they're based on a stable debian release.

Change-Id: I08c2826eba4aabd0be69955220624b2f179a15ee
Closes-bug: #1450198
"}]
commit_message:
debian-minimal: Remove -backport's restricted + universe

These are ubuntu-isms that do not exist on debian mirrors and cause
builds to break if they're based on a stable debian release.

Change-Id: I08c2826eba4aabd0be69955220624b2f179a15ee
Closes-bug: #1450198

commit_message:
Populating job type choices via api call

Rather than hard-code the choices for the job type
dropdown, they are now generated from an api call
that factors-in currently loaded plugins.  Also updated
the tests to utilize the new call.

Change-Id: I69f7100335bd35a891f23efd286da784c3d34e9f
Closes-Bug: #1371285

commit_message:
Make sure OVS restarts when Exception occurred

This fix let flows in br-tun automatically recover from an Exception,
which is an ideal situation.
Simplly improve a missed flag will make sure OVS restart properly
after we walked out of Exception loop.

Change-Id: Id0ac9399ec39fef19ce71566670ed245c681192e
Closes-Bug: #1439472

I3ad7864eeb2f959549ed356a1e34fa18804395cc didn't include any regression unit
tests to validate that the method won't ever log too often again,
reintroducing performance drop in later patches. It didn't play well
with stable backports of the fix, where context was lost when doing the
backport, that left the bug unfixed in stable/juno even though the patch
was merged there [1].

The patch adds an explicit note in the code that suggests not to add new
log messages inside the loop to avoid regression, and a unit test was
added to capture it.

Once the test is merged in master, it will be proposed for stable/juno
inclusion, with additional changes that would fix the regression again.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py
	neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py

Local changes:
- remove LOG.debug messages that sneaked into the for loop with a
  backport.

Related-Bug: #1414218
Change-Id: I5d43021932d6a994638c348eda277dd8337cf041
(cherry picked from commit 3b74095a935f6d2027e6bf04cc4aa21f8a1b46f2)
"}]
commit_message:
tests: confirm that _output_hosts_file does not log too often

I3ad7864eeb2f959549ed356a1e34fa18804395cc didn't include any regression unit
tests to validate that the method won't ever log too often again,
reintroducing performance drop in later patches. It didn't play well
with stable backports of the fix, where context was lost when doing the
backport, that left the bug unfixed in stable/juno even though the patch
was merged there [1].

The patch adds an explicit note in the code that suggests not to add new
log messages inside the loop to avoid regression, and a unit test was
added to capture it.

Once the test is merged in master, it will be proposed for stable/juno
inclusion, with additional changes that would fix the regression again.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py
	neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py

Local changes:
- remove LOG.debug messages that sneaked into the for loop with a
  backport.

Related-Bug: #1414218
Change-Id: I5d43021932d6a994638c348eda277dd8337cf041
(cherry picked from commit 3b74095a935f6d2027e6bf04cc4aa21f8a1b46f2)

commit_message:
Slave nodes are not booted

We restart all the NICs of master node after we ensure Cobbler is
ready. Restarting NIC breaks network connection between Cobbler
and outgoing physical network. Added another restart of the docker
container after network restart.

Change-Id: I0bbba2fbad801e109f52ee5fbcf203b8ba7d1dd8
Closes-Bug: #1427227
(cherry picked from commit 27634ecd26834d5242b7707b9e463ea90b9cf1bf)

commit_message:
Refactor assignment driver internal clean-up method names

As indicated by the TODO comment, two of the clean-up method
names in the assignment driver do not follow the logical pattern
of delete_<entity>_assignments(). This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: Iebc20b9bc7720fbfa0054888024f4aa12e83f42d
Closed-bug: 1438517

commit_message:
Merge create-backup functional tests of v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges create-backup functional tests.

Change-Id: I3edd045fa61e4e6469fce6ccc9d49e4f400c089f

commit_message:
Share hide server add tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges hide server addresses functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: I8c467050ea3ed666c3837d9c2846ae5d9b245c69

commit_message:
Do not delete LP images

We are seeing random docker load failures in performance tests, and we
think it is due to a potential concurrency issue in docker load and rmi.
So this patch avoids the deletion of LP images.

Change-Id: Ia415c2a0d3e10bb3477399c2ca8464921646ab06

To prepare for later uses of the RequestSpec object, and so that it can

instance that has been shoved into instance_properties has been split
into the component pieces that are used by current scheduler filters.

vm_state and task_state are used as well, but only for the host state

commit_message:
RequestSpec object split instance_properties

To prepare for later uses of the RequestSpec object, and so that it can
be more explicit about what is available for use during scheduling, the
instance that has been shoved into instance_properties has been split
into the component pieces that are used by current scheduler filters.

vm_state and task_state are used as well, but only for the host state
consume_from_instance method and they are never different between
requests so we can leave them out of there.

image_ref is used for one filter but should be available in
requestspec.image.

Change-Id: I5744367ce395dac1d300a740f67c0a17668dd952

commit_message:
Remove Future Parameters (write, list, delete) from ACL Validation Schema

Updated the validation schema for ACLs.
  - Removed write, list, and delete operations since they are not yet supported.
  - Added line for no additional properties other than "users" and "creator_only"
  - Added unit tests covering all of these and other conditions.
  - Updated unit tests to limit to "read" ACLs
  - Removed unit tests covering cases with more than one operation

Change-Id: Ie8a3abd22d02bb4a7bbedad373efa7435f3bdb3b
Closes-Bug: #1447872

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-28 16:21:30.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/test_snakeoil_ca.py', 'barbican/openstack/common/eventlet_backdoor.py', 'barbican/openstack/common/service.py', 'barbican/plugin/snakeoil_ca.py', 'barbican/openstack/common/fileutils.py', 'barbican/tests/queue/test_keystone_listener.py', 'barbican/openstack/common/sslutils.py', 'barbican/queue/keystone_listener.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package.

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I4e1cb4f1caaee61683dc9fb0ffc67e8f9e06dc6d
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package.

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I4e1cb4f1caaee61683dc9fb0ffc67e8f9e06dc6d

Closes-Bug: #1221757

commit_message:
Support add multiple images/tenants in members

The member-create and member-delete commands now allow multiple images
and tenants to be added with one command.

Before, we could only run:
    1) glance member-create <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID>
    2) glance member-delete <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID>

Now, we can create/delete multiple images and tenants:
    1) glance member-create --images <IMAGE> [<IMAGE> ...]
                            --tenants <TENANT_ID> [<TENANT_ID> ...]
    2) glance member-delete --images <IMAGE> [<IMAGE> ...]
                            --tenants <TENANT_ID> [<TENANT_ID> ...]

Change-Id: I77a9e0689c6af37f0e48b69a9ba34bdee2fc7e1e
Closes-Bug: #1221757

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-21 12:31:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix inefficient transaction usage in floating_ip_bulk_destroy

floating_ip_bulk_destroy was creating a session, then not using it
while it iterated over given ip ranges. Instead, it was creating a new
session for both retrieving and deleting floating ips.

Because these updates now happen in a transaction, they must be
committed before calling the reservations api, which expects to be
able to see the changes.

Note that this function still races:

* between querying floating ips and deleting floating ips
* between populating project_id_to_quota_count and updating quota

It needs to be re-architected. This change simply makes the current
behaviour more efficient.

Change-Id: I25635eeb6c85f834f740d7b4501b2f4df773a258
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inefficient transaction usage in floating_ip_bulk_destroy

floating_ip_bulk_destroy was creating a session, then not using it
while it iterated over given ip ranges. Instead, it was creating a new
session for both retrieving and deleting floating ips.

Because these updates now happen in a transaction, they must be
committed before calling the reservations api, which expects to be
able to see the changes.

Note that this function still races:

* between querying floating ips and deleting floating ips
* between populating project_id_to_quota_count and updating quota

It needs to be re-architected. This change simply makes the current
behaviour more efficient.

Change-Id: I25635eeb6c85f834f740d7b4501b2f4df773a258

subject: Add version removal rule to stop discovery warning
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-28 23:29:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Add version removal rule to stop discovery warning

Cinder recently added version discovery leveraging Keystone Client. For
cases where the service catalog still contains version numbers, this can
result in Keystone attempting to do discovery at the base url with the
version number and giving warnings. This will set a version removal rule
so Keystone can find the correct base url.

Change-Id: I71432468fea8bf1e50f180ab7f6dd69ee9aaa7e6
Closes-Bug: #1448244
'}]
commit_message:
Add version removal rule to stop discovery warning

Cinder recently added version discovery leveraging Keystone Client. For
cases where the service catalog still contains version numbers, this can
result in Keystone attempting to do discovery at the base url with the
version number and giving warnings. This will set a version removal rule
so Keystone can find the correct base url.

Change-Id: I71432468fea8bf1e50f180ab7f6dd69ee9aaa7e6
Closes-Bug: #1448244

pbr's next release treats such conflicts as errors. We need to either

Amphora SSH Driver

commit_message:
Fix ArchiveTestCase on MySQL due to differing exceptions

Inserting a row without providing all required values raises
OperationalError rather than DBError when using a MySQL backend.

Change-Id: If99e1971ae41e1438ae5dd85ab0b07928c7290e5

commit_message:
Enable filtering events on event_time

Currently, trying to filter on event time silently fails, the API
accepts the request but you get all events back.  This fixes that
problem and enables filtering on an exact match of a particular
event_time.

Change-Id: Idca18023678005b7f6f7c14d961fca579bd0cde0
Partial-Bug: #1444100

commit_message:
Fix ring data parser to allow for optional dispersion field

Swift was changed to add an option dispersion field to the output
of the swift-ring-builder command.  Also a line was added for the
overload factor, need to handle that as well.
Added a new spec for testing provider methods.

Change-Id: I1ae650e1514d69dc9c26b6054837f00fb4eb7bcb
Closes-Bug: #1444557

subject: WIP: Add first functional test for Kolla
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-06 06:41:39.000000000', 'files': ['docker/testenv/Dockerfile', 'docker/testenv/start.sh', 'devenv/kollanode.yaml', 'tests/test_rabbitmq.sh', 'docker/testenv/build'], 'message': "WIP: Add first functional test for Kolla

First test is written in bash, but start.sh in test container can easily
be extended to run a python test runner for python based tests. The test
container takes advantage of the compose link functionality to easily be
able to find the network address for a given service. Future services
will probably want to be queried via Keystone.

(WIP: I haven't created the testenv image due to possible renaming and
other potential incoming suggestions. The image in kollanode.yaml would
have to be changed. Had to remove net:host for link functionality.)

Change-Id: Ia7744e3b9755a5feca0c8e6be89c152a41e01567
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add first functional test for Kolla

First test is written in bash, but start.sh in test container can easily
be extended to run a python test runner for python based tests. The test
container takes advantage of the compose link functionality to easily be
able to find the network address for a given service. Future services
will probably want to be queried via Keystone.

(WIP: I haven't created the testenv image due to possible renaming and
other potential incoming suggestions. The image in kollanode.yaml would
have to be changed. Had to remove net:host for link functionality.)

Change-Id: Ia7744e3b9755a5feca0c8e6be89c152a41e01567

subject: Only delete 'owned' packages for --exists-action update
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-29 14:56:28.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'muranoclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Only delete 'owned' packages for --exists-action update

Due to the fact that fqns are no longer unique update might currently
not work correctly, because it searches for package to delete by fqn.
To improve this situation this patch attempts to search for the package
in the current tenant and deletes it by id.
In case it is not found - raise the error, cause it most likely means
that the package is in another tennant and deleting it automatically is
dangerous.
This change relies on 'owned' parameter in api sorting, fixed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177796/

Change-Id: Iee04ea65f5c4937ded4e259e3c0cb64189801da2
Closes-Bug: #1448135
"}]
commit_message:
Only delete 'owned' packages for --exists-action update

Due to the fact that fqns are no longer unique update might currently
not work correctly, because it searches for package to delete by fqn.
To improve this situation this patch attempts to search for the package
in the current tenant and deletes it by id.
In case it is not found - raise the error, cause it most likely means
that the package is in another tennant and deleting it automatically is
dangerous.
This change relies on 'owned' parameter in api sorting, fixed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177796/

Change-Id: Iee04ea65f5c4937ded4e259e3c0cb64189801da2
Closes-Bug: #1448135

commit_message:
Fixes a config load bug for keystone v3 domains

The config loading code for keystone v3 authtokens
require domian paramters, but the keystone middleware
currently doesn't have those configuration options.
This fixes the config loading for the domains.

Change-Id: Ieb1571e64ef52b8e48fe21883d3c9f57c8402a54

between catalog and manage requests

API behaviour.
* Simplify marker choice for next/prev links, since we reverse packages in

commit_message:
Take advantage of better API filtering catalog filtering

* Removed client-side filtering, since API is now distincts
between catalog and manage requests
* Do not use owned=True for manage requests, since this is now the default
API behaviour.
* Simplify marker choice for next/prev links, since we reverse packages in
case of sort_dir='desc' to preserve visual order of apps.

Change-Id: I24b7a2b3f1f7fa0d093d336beb8430a05e56bdaf
Related-Bug: #1448226

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-10 17:51:31.000000000', 'files': ['.gitreview', 'designate/api/v1/extensions/sync.py'], 'message': "Fix sync-record failing with 500 error

Central's sync_record() method takes 5 arguments, but API's sync_record()
is calling it with 4 arguments.  Added the missing argument, recordset_id.

Additionally, the .gitreview file is pointing at the old
stackforge/designate.git GITHub repository.  Fixed it to point to the
correct GITHub repository, openstack/designate.git.

Change-Id: Ib5802dde470c856e91a42326cf902d2e6ed8beed
Closes-Bug: #1430455
"}]
commit_message:
Fix sync-record failing with 500 error

Central's sync_record() method takes 5 arguments, but API's sync_record()
is calling it with 4 arguments.  Added the missing argument, recordset_id.

Additionally, the .gitreview file is pointing at the old
stackforge/designate.git GITHub repository.  Fixed it to point to the
correct GITHub repository, openstack/designate.git.

Change-Id: Ib5802dde470c856e91a42326cf902d2e6ed8beed
Closes-Bug: #1430455

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-13 14:11:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Ironic: do not destroy if node is in maintenance

This patch adds a check in the Ironic driver to prevent it from destroying
the instance if the node has been put in maintenance mode. The maintenance
mode in Ironic is a flag to indicate that something went wrong with the
node and a operator should take a look at it, therefore we should not
have an external service trying to modify the states in the Ironic node.

Related-Bug: #1443374
Change-Id: Ifb69fddd0a595a4b9fceee37841a132c23c24968
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: do not destroy if node is in maintenance

This patch adds a check in the Ironic driver to prevent it from destroying
the instance if the node has been put in maintenance mode. The maintenance
mode in Ironic is a flag to indicate that something went wrong with the
node and a operator should take a look at it, therefore we should not
have an external service trying to modify the states in the Ironic node.

Related-Bug: #1443374
Change-Id: Ifb69fddd0a595a4b9fceee37841a132c23c24968

subject: Set root disk == node disk for puppet jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-22 14:09:56.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Set root disk == node disk for puppet jobs

When using Puppet we don't want an ephemeral partition.
This patch configures the Puppet CI job such that the
ROOT_DISK is equal to the default NODE_DISK size
which means Ironic won't waste space on the ephemeral
partition.

This change will be important (required even) as we
expand the CI make use of things like Ceph which uses
/srv/data for its data storage by default... it would
be very easy to exceed the space on the root partition.

By simply making full use of the root disk we allow
project defaults to work seamlessly with our TripleO CI.

Change-Id: Icd85ed156fe167573cad976772c32bca1c84a04a
"}]
commit_message:
Set root disk == node disk for puppet jobs

When using Puppet we don't want an ephemeral partition.
This patch configures the Puppet CI job such that the
ROOT_DISK is equal to the default NODE_DISK size
which means Ironic won't waste space on the ephemeral
partition.

This change will be important (required even) as we
expand the CI make use of things like Ceph which uses
/srv/data for its data storage by default... it would
be very easy to exceed the space on the root partition.

By simply making full use of the root disk we allow
project defaults to work seamlessly with our TripleO CI.

Change-Id: Icd85ed156fe167573cad976772c32bca1c84a04a

Change-Id: Iadfdf4120c4d1c9b6976321753957fd4eecf301c

commit_message:
Disable dhcp_domain in Nova so we do not append .novalocal

Given we enforce network management via Neutron, this change will
make sure Nova is not appending the .novalocal domain to the guests
hostname. Neutron is providing its own default domain part as well
(openstacklocal) via dhcp.

Change-Id: Iadfdf4120c4d1c9b6976321753957fd4eecf301c

commit_message:
[WIP] Add dr-agent service.

Add dr-agent service to devstack for the development of
BGP dynamic routing blueprint:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/bgp-dynamic-routing

To run the service just add

    enable_service q-dragent

at your local.conf file. This is WIP and is pushed to help BGP reviewers
to test the feature.

Change-Id: I9c6faa8b5b95017c6a35bba9c0a9269d8f95c8c3
