revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-20 00:26:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_api_samples.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-shelve/os-unshelve.json.tpl', 'doc/api_samples/os-shelve/os-shelve.json', 'doc/api_samples/os-shelve/os-shelve-offload.json', 'doc/api_samples/os-shelve/os-unshelve.json', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/test_shelve.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-shelve/os-shelve.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-shelve/os-shelve-offload.json.tpl'], 'message': 'Merge server shelve tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges servers shelve functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: I16c565dab63d385633d406021709cbd6f9ddbc63
'}]
commit_message:
Merge server shelve tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges servers shelve functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: I16c565dab63d385633d406021709cbd6f9ddbc63

commit_message:
Merge suspend-server functional tests of v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges suspend-server functional tests.

Change-Id: I3074d2544acecabca57b199357ccdce0dcde6a04

subject: Check global requirements before running of tempest-dsvm-neutron-src
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-10 18:11:50.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-check.py', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Check global requirements before running of tempest-dsvm-neutron-src

{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-{name}{branch-designator} is
designed to verify compatibility with stable releases for library or
client projects. But OpenStack global requirements in a stable release
can contain top restriction for a project version. E.g. Juno restricts
novaclient version up to 2.20. So there is no need to run this check.
Moreover DevStack either fails to start, or starts with an old client.

This patch set introduce a requirement check script (based on project-
requirements-chage script) and use it in {pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-
neutron-src-{name}{branch-designator} template to skip a job if global
requirement for a project is defined and a project version doesn't fit
it.

Change-Id: Id87445047b3f161552192d75a2cc01129eeba342
"}]
commit_message:
Check global requirements before running of tempest-dsvm-neutron-src

{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-{name}{branch-designator} is
designed to verify compatibility with stable releases for library or
client projects. But OpenStack global requirements in a stable release
can contain top restriction for a project version. E.g. Juno restricts
novaclient version up to 2.20. So there is no need to run this check.
Moreover DevStack either fails to start, or starts with an old client.

This patch set introduce a requirement check script (based on project-
requirements-chage script) and use it in {pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-
neutron-src-{name}{branch-designator} template to skip a job if global
requirement for a project is defined and a project version doesn't fit
it.

Change-Id: Id87445047b3f161552192d75a2cc01129eeba342

commit_message:
Add Angular service to provide translation

Adds a service that provides an injectable service wrapping the existing
translation mechanism.  This helps with testing and abstracts away the
particular translation mechanism.  Applying the use of this service would
allow the code to reduce implicit dependencies on globally-scoped items.

Change-Id: Iff4e66996760810adf4ba4ac1b63a86313a042ed
Partial-Bug: 1446739

Fixed functional in tests_servers, to pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

In tests/unit/image/fake.py get_valid_image_id returned random

that stored in fake has 'auto_disk_config': 'True'

commit_message:
Update the Vendor Passthru documentation

This patch updates the documentation about the Nodes and Drivers Vendor
Passthru. It talks about the discoverability of the vendor methods via
the Ironic API, the support for multiple HTTP methods and what to expect
of a asynchrounous or synchrounous method.

Change-Id: I6a3c971dfe53cc7148ea2a51c6449bf729d39fa5

allow DEVSTACK_DIRS to be overridden

subject: Fix failures for integration tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-25 02:03:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/db/vpn/test_vpn_db.py'], 'message': 'Fix failures for integration tests

These unit tests were affected by the lack of callback registration.

Callbacks can be wiped out depending on the order in which subscriptions
and mocking of the callback registry manager takes place. By subscribing
during setUp, this ensures that the integration is in place so that
tests can pass.

Closes-bug: #1448245

Change-Id: I0dfa1ffa39403cbe00d2724fe21e6e22ef77e07d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failures for integration tests

These unit tests were affected by the lack of callback registration.

Callbacks can be wiped out depending on the order in which subscriptions
and mocking of the callback registry manager takes place. By subscribing
during setUp, this ensures that the integration is in place so that
tests can pass.

Closes-bug: #1448245

Change-Id: I0dfa1ffa39403cbe00d2724fe21e6e22ef77e07d

commit_message:
Make iptables firewall work with L3 plugin without DVR support

iptables firewall implementation expects 'distributed' attribute
is populated in router_info.router, but this attribute is only
populated when L3 plugin supports DVR extension. This commits
take into account the case where 'distributed' attribute does
not exist in router_info.router.

Change-Id: I2b0c208d74923f9ea0fc35bcea00e11152bbdb3d
Closes-Bug: #1448439

subject: Make the reaper use same timestamp for replica deletes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-16 13:34:38.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/account/test_reaper.py', 'test/probe/test_account_reaper.py', 'test/unit/common/test_direct_client.py', 'swift/common/direct_client.py', 'swift/account/reaper.py'], 'message': 'Make the reaper use same timestamp for replica deletes

The account reaper is using a unique timestamp when deleting
replicas of the same resource. This will result in unnecessary
replication traffic after reaping.

This patch makes the reaper use a single timestamp per resource.

Probe test is modified to check that delete times are equal
across replicas before replicators run.

test_direct_client.py is modified to check that it uses explicit
timestamp when passed to direct_delete_[object|container]
methods.

Drive-by bug fixes in the probe test e.g. it was not sending
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index when doing a direct GET to check
object state, so the 404s being verified could in fact be due
to diskfile not existing rather than diskfile being deleted.

Closes-Bug: 1442879
Change-Id: I8bab22d66308bb9d3294e1e0def017c784228423
'}]
commit_message:
Make the reaper use same timestamp for replica deletes

The account reaper is using a unique timestamp when deleting
replicas of the same resource. This will result in unnecessary
replication traffic after reaping.

This patch makes the reaper use a single timestamp per resource.

Probe test is modified to check that delete times are equal
across replicas before replicators run.

test_direct_client.py is modified to check that it uses explicit
timestamp when passed to direct_delete_[object|container]
methods.

Drive-by bug fixes in the probe test e.g. it was not sending
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index when doing a direct GET to check
object state, so the 404s being verified could in fact be due
to diskfile not existing rather than diskfile being deleted.

Closes-Bug: 1442879
Change-Id: I8bab22d66308bb9d3294e1e0def017c784228423

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 07:16:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': 'libvirt/utils.py: Remove 'encryption' flag from create_cow_image

Current code in create_cow_image inherits the 'encryption' property of a
qcow2 overlay from its backing file (also called base image).

However, importantly, even if the base image is encrypted, Nova has no
support for unencrypting it. So inherting the 'encryption' property
(from the backing file) serves no purpose. (Thanks Dan Berrange for
confirming this.)

Additionally, qcow2 encryption support is currently deprecated[1], with
plans[2] for a better future implementation, by upstream QEMU. Various
reasons (not least because of "flawed crypto") for it are noted in the
URL below, so it is reasonable to doubt if there are any serious users
of encyrpted images with its current design.

So, let's remove the 'encryption' flag from now.

[1] https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2015-03/msg03433.html
    -- "block: Deprecate QCOW/QCOW2 encryption"
[2] https://www.berrange.com/posts/2015/03/17/qemu-qcow2-built-in-encryption-just-say-no-deprecated-now-to-be-deleted-soon/

Change-Id: If61ee881c21835e5d538d0eb12383b4b4ef2cfd4
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt/utils.py: Remove 'encryption' flag from create_cow_image

Current code in create_cow_image inherits the 'encryption' property of a
qcow2 overlay from its backing file (also called base image).

However, importantly, even if the base image is encrypted, Nova has no
support for unencrypting it. So inherting the 'encryption' property
(from the backing file) serves no purpose. (Thanks Dan Berrange for
confirming this.)

Additionally, qcow2 encryption support is currently deprecated[1], with
plans[2] for a better future implementation, by upstream QEMU. Various
reasons (not least because of "flawed crypto") for it are noted in the
URL below, so it is reasonable to doubt if there are any serious users
of encyrpted images with its current design.

So, let's remove the 'encryption' flag from now.

[1] https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2015-03/msg03433.html
    -- "block: Deprecate QCOW/QCOW2 encryption"
[2] https://www.berrange.com/posts/2015/03/17/qemu-qcow2-built-in-encryption-just-say-no-deprecated-now-to-be-deleted-soon/

Change-Id: If61ee881c21835e5d538d0eb12383b4b4ef2cfd4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 07:16:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': 'libvirt/utils.py: Remove needless code from create_cow_image

The said code was added (but commented out) by this commit
51441e369bb05e9cb9149ac9a7290fe541e3ed1a, which hoped to inherit
'preallocation' (of qcow2 metadata) property of a qcow2 overlay from its
backing file.

I.e. if you create a base image with 'preallocation' option:

    $ qemu-img create -f qcow2 base.qcow2 1G -o preallocation=metadata

And, create an overlay with the above image as its backing file and
provide the 'preallocation' option:

    $ qemu-img create -f qcow2 -b ./base.qcow2 -F qcow2 \
               overlay.qcow2 -o preallocation=metadata

it results in the below error:

    "qemu-img: overlay2.qcow2: Backing file and preallocation cannot be
    used at the same time"

QEMU upstream source confirms that, it is indeed an invalid combination
This behavior has not changed since the feature to preallocate qcow2
metadata was introduced originally[1].

So, it is safe to remove the commented out code, which is trying to do
supply an invalid combination of options to `qemu-img`.

[1] http://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=a35e1c17 --
    ("qcow2: Metadata preallocation", 17 AUG 2009)

Change-Id: I39a10c9c5a9e164cabff97292a53bf0023cfb43e
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt/utils.py: Remove needless code from create_cow_image

The said code was added (but commented out) by this commit
51441e369bb05e9cb9149ac9a7290fe541e3ed1a, which hoped to inherit
'preallocation' (of qcow2 metadata) property of a qcow2 overlay from its
backing file.

I.e. if you create a base image with 'preallocation' option:

    $ qemu-img create -f qcow2 base.qcow2 1G -o preallocation=metadata

And, create an overlay with the above image as its backing file and
provide the 'preallocation' option:

    $ qemu-img create -f qcow2 -b ./base.qcow2 -F qcow2 \
               overlay.qcow2 -o preallocation=metadata

it results in the below error:

    "qemu-img: overlay2.qcow2: Backing file and preallocation cannot be
    used at the same time"

QEMU upstream source confirms that, it is indeed an invalid combination
This behavior has not changed since the feature to preallocate qcow2
metadata was introduced originally[1].

So, it is safe to remove the commented out code, which is trying to do
supply an invalid combination of options to `qemu-img`.

[1] http://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=a35e1c17 --
    ("qcow2: Metadata preallocation", 17 AUG 2009)

Change-Id: I39a10c9c5a9e164cabff97292a53bf0023cfb43e

commit_message:
Give post queue normal priority

Right now publishing of documents to docs.openstack.org takes more than
3 hours - and that is quite long for getting everything ready and tested
for the kilo release.

Since we have the nodes, raise the priority again to normal.

Change-Id: I0497549ddf428ad3539b3afbe25a021a6780563a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-28 07:16:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': "libvirt/utils.py: Clarify comment in create_cow_image function

The below commit:

    commit 51441e369bb05e9cb9149ac9a7290fe541e3ed1a
    Author: Joshua Harlow <harlowja@yahoo-inc.com>
    Date:   Mon Sep 17 16:42:33 2012 -0700

        Inherit the base images qcow2 properties

introduced the behavior: when creating a qcow2 overlay from a base
image, the overlay image inherits properties like 'cluster_size' from
its backing file.

Explanation about it in the comment was not clear and had a URL to an
expired pastebin. Reword the comment with details (also remove an
outdated TODO item and an expired pastebin).

Some related notes:

Speaking with a QEMU block layer developer, Kevin Wolf, he clarifies
that qcow2 overlay images do _not_ inherit properties from its backing
file (assuming it had a non-default 'cluster_size' value). I.e. when
creating images with `qemu-img` tool, all options to it need to be
explicitly specified (except for 'size' of the disk image, if it isn't
specified).

Cases where inheriting the 'cluster_size' of an overlay image from its
backing file might be useful (thanks Dan Berrange, for the below
discussion):

  - Qcow2 default cluster_size has changed in the past (last in June
    2009, for version 0.11 -- confirmed with QEMU upstream) so depending
    on what specific version of QEMU people use to create images they
    upload (to Glance), it might affect things.
  - People might use a particular cluster_size that is matching some
    aspect of their storage. (Though, in practise, this seems to be very
    rare and might be useful in some really special storage
    environments.)
     - NOTE: A (global) default qcow2 'cluster_size' value of
       65536 bytes (i.e. 64 KiB) is used by QEMU when creating qcow2
       images.

Change-Id: I6ffe6f7454383faac753709db7013380c91517da
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt/utils.py: Clarify comment in create_cow_image function

The below commit:

    commit 51441e369bb05e9cb9149ac9a7290fe541e3ed1a
    Author: Joshua Harlow <harlowja@yahoo-inc.com>
    Date:   Mon Sep 17 16:42:33 2012 -0700

        Inherit the base images qcow2 properties

introduced the behavior: when creating a qcow2 overlay from a base
image, the overlay image inherits properties like 'cluster_size' from
its backing file.

Explanation about it in the comment was not clear and had a URL to an
expired pastebin. Reword the comment with details (also remove an
outdated TODO item and an expired pastebin).

Some related notes:

Speaking with a QEMU block layer developer, Kevin Wolf, he clarifies
that qcow2 overlay images do _not_ inherit properties from its backing
file (assuming it had a non-default 'cluster_size' value). I.e. when
creating images with `qemu-img` tool, all options to it need to be
explicitly specified (except for 'size' of the disk image, if it isn't
specified).

Cases where inheriting the 'cluster_size' of an overlay image from its
backing file might be useful (thanks Dan Berrange, for the below
discussion):

  - Qcow2 default cluster_size has changed in the past (last in June
    2009, for version 0.11 -- confirmed with QEMU upstream) so depending
    on what specific version of QEMU people use to create images they
    upload (to Glance), it might affect things.
  - People might use a particular cluster_size that is matching some
    aspect of their storage. (Though, in practise, this seems to be very
    rare and might be useful in some really special storage
    environments.)
     - NOTE: A (global) default qcow2 'cluster_size' value of
       65536 bytes (i.e. 64 KiB) is used by QEMU when creating qcow2
       images.

Change-Id: I6ffe6f7454383faac753709db7013380c91517da

Currently, the Subject created for the X509 certificate
is too long, resulting in exceptions and failing to
create the keypair.

This change shortens the Subject.
Unit test added to prove the issue's existence.

Issue found by: Andrey Kurilin

Co-authored-by: Andrey Kurilin <akurilin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I7885c120ce81a22d416f806779bf9a12092d5040
Closes-Bug: #1447653
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes X509 keypair creation failure

Currently, the Subject created for the X509 certificate
is too long, resulting in exceptions and failing to
create the keypair.

This change shortens the Subject.
Unit test added to prove the issue's existence.

Issue found by: Andrey Kurilin

Co-authored-by: Andrey Kurilin <akurilin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I7885c120ce81a22d416f806779bf9a12092d5040
Closes-Bug: #1447653

commit_message:
Remove GW metric and default GW for br-mgmt

Default GW for Admin network is now set to GW from Admin network
for non-default node network group if it is set. Default GW for
Admin network is set to Master node IP otherwise.
Default GW for Admin network is only set for nodes where br-ex is absent.

Related-Bug: #1437842
Related-Bug: #1442078
Change-Id: I4ef6415436afb380eb5da32bde2943699da3c3ef

subject: Fix publishdocs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 17:40:08.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix publishdocs

publishdocs failed when there was no content in publish-docs/draft and
then did not publish any files.

Failing is fine for the sed command, so add a "|| true". Also use
"mkdir -p" to ignore errors if publish-docs already exists.

Change-Id: I2cdcf155f583057fc56392ec44d8affffceafc9c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix publishdocs

publishdocs failed when there was no content in publish-docs/draft and
then did not publish any files.

Failing is fine for the sed command, so add a "|| true". Also use
"mkdir -p" to ignore errors if publish-docs already exists.

Change-Id: I2cdcf155f583057fc56392ec44d8affffceafc9c

commit_message:
Linuxbridge Agent with ML2: switch provider

Like we did in OVS agent when running ML2 plugin, we need to:
* use neutron_agent_linuxbridge provider to configure the right config file.

Closes-bug: #1426080
Change-Id: Icf7391563dbfcafb788d23b0367fba810a90fb48

subject: Only delete 'owned' packages for --exists-action update
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-29 15:10:58.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'muranoclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Only delete 'owned' packages for --exists-action update

Due to the fact that fqns are no longer unique update might currently
not work correctly, because it searches for package to delete by fqn.
To improve this situation this patch attempts to search for the package
in the current tenant and deletes it by id.
In case it is not found - raise the error, cause it most likely means
that the package is in another tennant and deleting it automatically is
dangerous.
This change relies on 'owned' parameter in api sorting, fixed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177796/

Change-Id: Iee04ea65f5c4937ded4e259e3c0cb64189801da2
Closes-Bug: #1448135
"}]
commit_message:
Only delete 'owned' packages for --exists-action update

Due to the fact that fqns are no longer unique update might currently
not work correctly, because it searches for package to delete by fqn.
To improve this situation this patch attempts to search for the package
in the current tenant and deletes it by id.
In case it is not found - raise the error, cause it most likely means
that the package is in another tennant and deleting it automatically is
dangerous.
This change relies on 'owned' parameter in api sorting, fixed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177796/

Change-Id: Iee04ea65f5c4937ded4e259e3c0cb64189801da2
Closes-Bug: #1448135

commit_message:
view hypervisor details rest api should be allowed for non-admins

The current call to show hypervisor is broken and expects the
user to have admin privileges always.It does not allow non-
admin users to view hypervisor details. This should be
controlled based on the rule defined in the policy.json rather
than have the permissions mandated programmatically. This bug
is caused due to regression and was working earlier.So the
changes proposed here is merely retaining the older behavior.
To ensure that this works as before, the context passed to the
db api layer is elevated so that it passes the requires_admin_
context check that is present in the db layer.

Change-Id: I50437788aac72608998cf9c24d4d562b1ff20301
Closes-Bug: 1447084

commit_message:
Add EL7 support

If Fedora is 20 or more, CentOS / Red Hat 7, we want to install EPEL7.
Otherwise, we want to setup EPEL6 for backward compatibility with Fedora
19 and before, and CentOS / Red Hat 6.X and before.

Closes-bug #1422516
Change-Id: Iea9ed9cfdd9a70074257009a19533094769b2e9f

'}]
commit_message:
Allow env var REPO_OS to easily switch between platforms

Use a env var instead of manually editing repo files to use
centos.   This also makes it easy for new tools like, test-patch
to switch between the platforms.

Next step will be to allow REPO_DEVICE=  to easily
setup the network interfaces in the multi node cases.

I think env vars are a simple way to handle this, but we could also
consider an user config file ~/openstack-chef-repo.cnf.  Thoughts?

Change-Id: I82e82b35b51e08ff503fdb10fa1ce041c4be4af2

subject: Fix sort column for event-list with nested-depth
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 7256, 'name': 'Randall Burt', 'email': 'randall.burt@rackspace.com', 'username': 'randall-burt'}, {'_account_id': 7404, 'name': 'Ethan Lynn', 'email': 'xuanlangjian@gmail.com', 'username': 'GaryLynn'}, {'_account_id': 8246, 'name': 'Qiming Teng', 'email': 'tengqm@outlook.com', 'username': 'tengqm'}, {'_account_id': 15881, 'name': 'Limor Stotland', 'email': 'limor.bortman@nokia.com', 'username': 'LimorStotlamd'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-28 21:13:19.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix sort column for event-list with nested-depth

The non-nested-depth case can rely on the sort ordering from the
API response, but because we mangle together the response from
several event-list API calls in the nested-depth call, it's necessary
to ensure the sort ordering is correct by sorting on event_time.

Currently, we're sorting on the wrong column, because of the logic
which inserts a new column heading after we look up the index,
but switching to the right column still relies on the prettytable
sortby_index, which doesn't work with the "start" slice option,
if you want post-sort slicing (such as will be required to make
--marker and --limit work with the --nested-depth option, in a
later patch).

So, instead, pre-sort the list before passing to print_list, which
solves the immediate problem of wrong sort order, and provides
an easier step towards enabling marker/limit.

Change-Id: Ifc6c8875cfdc58c0185fbffe7d00a45a598d67bd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sort column for event-list with nested-depth

The non-nested-depth case can rely on the sort ordering from the
API response, but because we mangle together the response from
several event-list API calls in the nested-depth call, it's necessary
to ensure the sort ordering is correct by sorting on event_time.

Currently, we're sorting on the wrong column, because of the logic
which inserts a new column heading after we look up the index,
but switching to the right column still relies on the prettytable
sortby_index, which doesn't work with the "start" slice option,
if you want post-sort slicing (such as will be required to make
--marker and --limit work with the --nested-depth option, in a
later patch).

So, instead, pre-sort the list before passing to print_list, which
solves the immediate problem of wrong sort order, and provides
an easier step towards enabling marker/limit.

Change-Id: Ifc6c8875cfdc58c0185fbffe7d00a45a598d67bd

commit_message:
moving from bundler to chefdk

- deprecated Gemfile
- updated Rakefile to use 'chef exec' instead of 'bundle exec'
- updated TESTING.md
- replaced Runner in specs with SoloRunner for new chefspec version
- initialized file_cache_path to make git_sync spec for docker work

Change-Id: I845c712f2d0d216d9d4a9d32c28ac4b03e96109a

commit_message:
Set the master requirements to the head of stable/kilo

Most of master is transitioning to the liberty cycle, to allow us
to continue gating the service install versions is being set back
to the head of the stable/kilo branch. This should be updated once
all upstream OpenStack projects fully transition to Liberty.

Change-Id: I5a1d27c0e86a11ebe8d97b2e1a8dfef21cb5d6fd

between catalog and manage requests
* Do not use owned=True for manage requests, since this is now the default
API behaviour.
* Simplify marker choice for next/prev links, since we reverse packages in

Depends-On: Ica031058d963246ff4d76e52cfc8b8b44d207c9a
Related-Bug: #1448226

commit_message:
Take advantage of better API filtering catalog filtering

* Removed client-side filtering, since API is now distincts
between catalog and manage requests
* Do not use owned=True for manage requests, since this is now the default
API behaviour.
* Simplify marker choice for next/prev links, since we reverse packages in
case of sort_dir='desc' to preserve visual order of apps.

Change-Id: I0136307e09695f49663779570cf23560521d9585
Depends-On: Ica031058d963246ff4d76e52cfc8b8b44d207c9a
Related-Bug: #1448226

commit_message:
Remove pxe-service flag in Cobbler and GPXE exclusion

These options block Broadcom BCM5720 cards from PXE
boot and are not necessary for provisioning.

Change-Id: I4c6520bca8549fe96264f25827bc1e534669b860
Closes-Bug: #1410280

commit_message:
Reconfigure default route

We have some roles which are deployed before vrouter deployment
due to we need to reconfigure default route after vrouter is ready.

Default route reconfiguration:
* add new configure_default_route puppet function
* add new configure_default_route task in post deploy
* add tests

Change-Id: I5db09111a9eecad058654e5463ffb13d077cee70
Closes-bug: #1444962

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 14:13:36.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "[IBP]: fix 'udevadm trigger' hanging

After unblacklisting of udev rules fuel-agent calls
'udevadm trigger' followed by 'udevadm settle'.
'trigger' cause to re-process of completely all of udev events even
not related to block devices activities.
According to udev's event monitor it gets stuck on processing
network devices related events.

In order to avoid re-triggering of NICs, fuel-agent should use available
match for subsystem:
eg.: 'udevadm trigger --subsystem-match=block'

With subsystem match enabled, it always takes just 0.05-0.1s to complete.

Change-Id: I5537a30dc531469aa5bd5b7276628a27c461ddce
Closes-Bug: #1450007
"}]
commit_message:
[IBP]: fix 'udevadm trigger' hanging

After unblacklisting of udev rules fuel-agent calls
'udevadm trigger' followed by 'udevadm settle'.
'trigger' cause to re-process of completely all of udev events even
not related to block devices activities.
According to udev's event monitor it gets stuck on processing
network devices related events.

In order to avoid re-triggering of NICs, fuel-agent should use available
match for subsystem:
eg.: 'udevadm trigger --subsystem-match=block'

With subsystem match enabled, it always takes just 0.05-0.1s to complete.

Change-Id: I5537a30dc531469aa5bd5b7276628a27c461ddce
Closes-Bug: #1450007

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-28 20:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_cinder/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': "Fix cinder-backup deployment issues

Currently, cinder-backup isn't getting deployed correctly.  This commit
fixes two of the known issues so that we correctly update cinder.conf
on the cinder_volume hosts and also update the
cinder_service_backup_program_name so we correctly deploy the init
script for cinder-backup.

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: I18551197d5f3e6349a22e13f989b4c38ad6030af
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder-backup deployment issues

Currently, cinder-backup isn't getting deployed correctly.  This commit
fixes two of the known issues so that we correctly update cinder.conf
on the cinder_volume hosts and also update the
cinder_service_backup_program_name so we correctly deploy the init
script for cinder-backup.

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: I18551197d5f3e6349a22e13f989b4c38ad6030af

commit_message:
Pmanager: fix 'udevadm trigger' hanging

After unblacklisting of udev rules pmanager calls
'udevadm trigger' followed by 'udevadm settle'.
'trigger' cause to re-process of completely all of udev events even
not related to block devices activities.
According to udev's event monitor it gets stuck on processing
network devices related events.

In order to avoid re-triggering of NICs, pmanager should use available
match for subsystem:
eg.: 'udevadm trigger --subsystem-match=block'

With subsystem match enabled, it always takes just 0.05-0.1s to complete.

Change-Id: Id40d12f8799033d22c3b87b9bf143fb3a6445484
Closes-Bug: #1450007

commit_message:
Update iLO documentation for capabilities

This commit updates the iLO documentation with the
nova flavor examples for how the iLO capabilities
can be used for scheduling.
It also updates the documentation for automatic
boot ISO creation for iscsi_ilo driver.

Change-Id: I392d3e5d46b62fa195d176b54e150258880f061f

commit_message:
Leverage timeutils, drop strtime() usage

This patch remove some code that tried to parse time in different way by
leveraging timeutils instead. It also drops strtime() usage as it's
going to be deprecated in oslo_utils (see
I8b5119e64369ccac3423dccc04421f99912df733).

Change-Id: Icb2906ccd4b381f80064e0f1348fc64e389031dd

commit_message:
Make SSL settings configurable for Glance

This commit allows enabling SSL for glance-api and registry
endpoints by adding few new node attributes. Glance API and registry
configuration files are also modified to use these node attributes.

With these changes, users can easily enable SSL - both in secure and
insecure mode. However, it is user's responsibility to generate and
provide location of SSL certificate and its key.

Closes-Bug #1445773

Change-Id: I1d0f776efb392e058bc3dbf0ee5223512b60f584

subject: Amend RequestSpec blueprint by using an ImageMeta object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 08:55:41.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/request-spec-object.rst'], 'message': "Amend RequestSpec blueprint by using an ImageMeta object

The approved spec was mentioning a DictOfStrings as the typed field for the
image information but that can't work due to the nested properties dict
contained in the image information.

Instead, the proposal is to work on a new ImageMeta object which would
basically propose https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76234

Change-Id: I440632043aeb72b1f2e585c3c12caed089ffcefa
Previously-Approved: Kilo
"}]
commit_message:
Amend RequestSpec blueprint by using an ImageMeta object

The approved spec was mentioning a DictOfStrings as the typed field for the
image information but that can't work due to the nested properties dict
contained in the image information.

Instead, the proposal is to work on a new ImageMeta object which would
basically propose https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76234

Change-Id: I440632043aeb72b1f2e585c3c12caed089ffcefa
Previously-Approved: Kilo

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I75e6e15d50ef9830d0581efd4cbcceb3e626f7b7

Fixed incorrect version of PciDeviceList.

Also, versions of Instance, BlockDeviceMapping, FixedIp and
FloatingIp were updated because of dependence.

subject: Use ipv4 subnet in Heat scenario tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-29 11:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/scenario/templates/test_neutron_loadbalancer.yaml', 'heat_integrationtests/scenario/test_server_cfn_init.py', 'heat_integrationtests/scenario/scenario_base.py', 'heat_integrationtests/common/test.py', 'heat_integrationtests/scenario/test_neutron_loadbalancer.py'], 'message': 'Use ipv4 subnet in Heat scenario tests

Previously we used first subnet from network and it was correct, because
there was only one subnet in network by default. According to the last changes
in devstack new ipv6 subnet was added to the all default networks.
This patch adds function to the base class, which allows to choose
subnet based on ip version. All scenario tests were updated to use only ipv4
subnet.

Also was added property for FIP, which specify ip of vip.

Change-Id: I199075909b97fe98e1a3c1d175b0b4cf7100403d
Closes-Bug: #1449896
'}]
commit_message:
Use ipv4 subnet in Heat scenario tests

Previously we used first subnet from network and it was correct, because
there was only one subnet in network by default. According to the last changes
in devstack new ipv6 subnet was added to the all default networks.
This patch adds function to the base class, which allows to choose
subnet based on ip version. All scenario tests were updated to use only ipv4
subnet.

Also was added property for FIP, which specify ip of vip.

Change-Id: I199075909b97fe98e1a3c1d175b0b4cf7100403d
Closes-Bug: #1449896

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-28 19:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add support for forcing migrate_flavor_data

In some cases it might be helpful to force the migration of flavor
data. For example, when operating on a snapshot of a production
database there may be instances in an operating state that would
stop the migration from finishing. Blocking on this will make it
impossible to finish the migrations (once the migrations require
all the data has been migrated).

Change-Id: I4f6c0679b144897f2bfc2fa06bc7c72b25a85fd3
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for forcing migrate_flavor_data

In some cases it might be helpful to force the migration of flavor
data. For example, when operating on a snapshot of a production
database there may be instances in an operating state that would
stop the migration from finishing. Blocking on this will make it
impossible to finish the migrations (once the migrations require
all the data has been migrated).

Change-Id: I4f6c0679b144897f2bfc2fa06bc7c72b25a85fd3

In the absence of a specified fixed address with which to associate a
floating IP, the first IPv4 address on the port should be associated.
Without the check for IPv4, IPv6 ports can be associated with a (IPv4)
floating IP, which is not supported.

Change-Id: Ib66a9109cc1c7999474daca5970d0af1f70886e4
Closes-Bug: 1437855
'}]
commit_message:
Associate floating IPs with first v4 fixed IP if none specified

In the absence of a specified fixed address with which to associate a
floating IP, the first IPv4 address on the port should be associated.
Without the check for IPv4, IPv6 ports can be associated with a (IPv4)
floating IP, which is not supported.

Change-Id: Ib66a9109cc1c7999474daca5970d0af1f70886e4
Closes-Bug: 1437855

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 19:37:54.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/test_audit_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/audit.py', 'keystonemiddleware/i18n.py', 'keystonemiddleware/openstack/common/memorycache.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I977248bec9560bcd730efe6bed741f1dc025fdf3
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I977248bec9560bcd730efe6bed741f1dc025fdf3

The default, 30 seconds, is the default used by nova if the parameter isn't

Change-Id: Ie64c549ae4fc8bffeeced0e6c1d298c8faf29d31

commit_message:
Include neutron_url_timeout in nova.conf

This change adds an attribute for neutron_url_timeout and a
corresponding parameter in the nova.conf template.

The default, 30 seconds, is the default used by nova if the parameter isn't
set.

Change-Id: Ie64c549ae4fc8bffeeced0e6c1d298c8faf29d31

subject: Allow to use network label in nova_fixed handler format
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-23 15:08:01.000000000', 'files': ['designate/notification_handler/base.py', 'designate/tests/test_notification_handler/test_nova.py', 'designate/notification_handler/nova.py'], 'message': 'Allow to use network label in nova_fixed handler format

Nova notifications provide network label per fixed_ip in create
payloads. This change updates code to allow nova_fixed handler format
to use the key "label" providing network label. The format:

 %(instance_name)s.%(label)s.%(domain)s

returns the fqdn:

 instanceXX.netYY.domainZZ

for instanceXX on netYY with domainZZ as nova_fixed handler domain.

Change-Id: I7ffef6464ab5e8e8f1e74dca8fcff972c2ad6d58
Closes-Bug: #1446242
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to use network label in nova_fixed handler format

Nova notifications provide network label per fixed_ip in create
payloads. This change updates code to allow nova_fixed handler format
to use the key "label" providing network label. The format:

 %(instance_name)s.%(label)s.%(domain)s

returns the fqdn:

 instanceXX.netYY.domainZZ

for instanceXX on netYY with domainZZ as nova_fixed handler domain.

Change-Id: I7ffef6464ab5e8e8f1e74dca8fcff972c2ad6d58
Closes-Bug: #1446242

We used to create differential Ubuntu and Centos

commit_message:
Remove differential (diff) repos

We used to create differential Ubuntu and Centos
repositories for new Fuel versions to make them
smaller. However, this technique contradicts
our current upgrade/patching approach. So, this
patch removes this functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1447135
Related-Bug: #1446293

Change-Id: I6c9288e77c6ccc5872056a8119230ec725846bba

commit_message:
Fix order of API operation listing

Fix some APIs to add missing methods
Fix name of WADLs to match resource names
Add introduction that describes order of operations
on the page
Correct resource names in section titles
Updated commit message to remove bug - that bug
was fixed through other changes

Change-Id: If2ab354d1a25a92b0965c35596c6240467c7eec5

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-24 15:11:12.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/ns_haproxy'], 'message': "Add a dummy parameter for HAProxy resource

HAProxy resource supports reload operation but currently Pacemaker doesn't use
it if one of the unique parameters is changed. It was discovered that
a resource needs at least one parameter marked as unique=1.
Adding such dummy parameter to keep all current parameters unchanged and solve
the problem.

Change-Id: I54b7f838c9592736e61d997d30a15497e5c31604
Closes-bug: #1448160
"}]
commit_message:
Add a dummy parameter for HAProxy resource

HAProxy resource supports reload operation but currently Pacemaker doesn't use
it if one of the unique parameters is changed. It was discovered that
a resource needs at least one parameter marked as unique=1.
Adding such dummy parameter to keep all current parameters unchanged and solve
the problem.

Change-Id: I54b7f838c9592736e61d997d30a15497e5c31604
Closes-bug: #1448160

commit_message:
Add Http Request Scenario

* (сheck-random-request) Add Multiple Http request scenario which
takes as input a list of Requests and compares response of random
picked request from the list with the expected Response.

* (сheck-request) Improve flexiblity of check-response scenario and
rename check-response to check-request.

Co-Authored-By: kumar rishabh <shailrishabh@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Roman Vasilets <rvasilets@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Id70935616c013271392219b1e642b5b87ddb4b9c

commit_message:
Use labels for virtual media dev in Ironic ramdisk

This commit changes Ironic deploy ramdisk to find out
the virtual media device by using labels instead of
looking at the model of block device.  This helps in
finding out the device irrespective of the hardware.
Corresponding Ironic change is
If5b78d9af7048f2631d050ee5ce01ab7a67e2354.

Closes-Bug: #1429340
Change-Id: I5e8a706989bad13051eb47db0b1e762e6c672318

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-29 13:03:52.000000000', 'files': ['packages/deb/module.mk'], 'message': 'packages/deb: fix target dependencies so make -j works again

Both repocleanup.done and reprepro.done targets
 - modify the local copy of MOS repo (which is a bad idea),
 - depend on ubuntu/mirror.done target

As a result two instances of reprepro try to concurrently modify the same
APT repo (which fails). Make repocleanup.done depend on reprepro.done to
avoid the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1449723
Change-Id: I283f4f10f9e1b43eb8a30cb9458a3443cc614e23
'}]
commit_message:
packages/deb: fix target dependencies so make -j works again

Both repocleanup.done and reprepro.done targets
 - modify the local copy of MOS repo (which is a bad idea),
 - depend on ubuntu/mirror.done target

As a result two instances of reprepro try to concurrently modify the same
APT repo (which fails). Make repocleanup.done depend on reprepro.done to
avoid the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1449723
Change-Id: I283f4f10f9e1b43eb8a30cb9458a3443cc614e23

commit_message:
[IBP] turn off firewall on centos

Firewall should be disabled as it makes no sense to configure it as
FUEL will override network settings in a matter of seconds.

Change-Id: I9c7fbe3e129efa536dd9104341dabb6a384229f9
Closes-Bug: #1441136

subject: Initialize RabbitMQ on bootstrap node first
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-20 10:04:45.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp'], 'message': 'Initialize RabbitMQ on bootstrap node first

Generally there can be problems with starting RabbitMQ on all nodes at
the same time -- it might fail to initialize and start. We now
initialize RabbitMQ on the bootstrap node first in step 1 and on the
other nodes in step 2. See the linked bug and discussion [1] for more
info.

[1] http://rabbitmq.1065348.n5.nabble.com/Rabbitmq-boot-failure-with-quot-tables-not-present-quot-td24494.html

Closes-Bug: #1443426
Change-Id: I94790db483ab1ef3b27cf8a9543ff3d78efb9e06
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize RabbitMQ on bootstrap node first

Generally there can be problems with starting RabbitMQ on all nodes at
the same time -- it might fail to initialize and start. We now
initialize RabbitMQ on the bootstrap node first in step 1 and on the
other nodes in step 2. See the linked bug and discussion [1] for more
info.

[1] http://rabbitmq.1065348.n5.nabble.com/Rabbitmq-boot-failure-with-quot-tables-not-present-quot-td24494.html

Closes-Bug: #1443426
Change-Id: I94790db483ab1ef3b27cf8a9543ff3d78efb9e06

subject: API calls to Registry now maintain Request IDs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-22 21:55:43.000000000', 'files': ['glance/registry/client/v1/client.py', 'glance/registry/client/v1/api.py', 'glance/api/middleware/context.py'], 'message': 'API calls to Registry now maintain Request IDs

Previously, glance-api calls to glance-registry did not include the
req-UUID request ID in that call. Instead a single call to glance-api
used separate request IDs for api and registry, leading to some
difficulty in traceback, debugging, and tracking bugs going into
glance and into registry.

Previous example log in glance-api:
2015-04-21 07:25:10.359 126050 DEBUG glance.registry.client.v1.client
[req-f2abec73-7a8c-4c5a-bded-f5eb82d627e4 5fca8fda352e46c7a006d4bf8083ab
be 00eb1978c3394438b8988cd8a755f128 - - -] Registry request GET /images/
05454482-f448-424b-ba9d-49d44a5af9fb HTTP 200 request id req-req-2433213
e-76c2-4ce3-95b6-d0db6cc8bdd0 do_request /opt/stack/glance/glance/
registry/client/v1/client.py:131

Updated example log in glance-api:
2015-04-21 07:27:33.057 126165 DEBUG glance.registry.client.v1.client
[req-1787ffe1-0537-4357-a735-18412292434d 5fca8fda352e46c7a006d4bf8083ab
be 00eb1978c3394438b8988cd8a755f128 - - -] Registry request GET /images/
05454482-f448-424b-ba9d-49d44a5af9fb HTTP 200 request id req-req-1787ffe
1-0537-4357-a735-18412292434d do_request /opt/stack/glance/glance/
registry/client/v1/client.py:131

Now, when glance-api calls glance-registry, the api request_id is passed
to registry. This helps to maintain the request ID for api and registry
when user makes a single call to api.

Change-Id: I871c1c17aca9af291598279db1d4057e217b4256
Closes-Bug: #1336958
'}]
commit_message:
API calls to Registry now maintain Request IDs

Previously, glance-api calls to glance-registry did not include the
req-UUID request ID in that call. Instead a single call to glance-api
used separate request IDs for api and registry, leading to some
difficulty in traceback, debugging, and tracking bugs going into
glance and into registry.

Previous example log in glance-api:
2015-04-21 07:25:10.359 126050 DEBUG glance.registry.client.v1.client
[req-f2abec73-7a8c-4c5a-bded-f5eb82d627e4 5fca8fda352e46c7a006d4bf8083ab
be 00eb1978c3394438b8988cd8a755f128 - - -] Registry request GET /images/
05454482-f448-424b-ba9d-49d44a5af9fb HTTP 200 request id req-req-2433213
e-76c2-4ce3-95b6-d0db6cc8bdd0 do_request /opt/stack/glance/glance/
registry/client/v1/client.py:131

Updated example log in glance-api:
2015-04-21 07:27:33.057 126165 DEBUG glance.registry.client.v1.client
[req-1787ffe1-0537-4357-a735-18412292434d 5fca8fda352e46c7a006d4bf8083ab
be 00eb1978c3394438b8988cd8a755f128 - - -] Registry request GET /images/
05454482-f448-424b-ba9d-49d44a5af9fb HTTP 200 request id req-req-1787ffe
1-0537-4357-a735-18412292434d do_request /opt/stack/glance/glance/
registry/client/v1/client.py:131

Now, when glance-api calls glance-registry, the api request_id is passed
to registry. This helps to maintain the request ID for api and registry
when user makes a single call to api.

Change-Id: I871c1c17aca9af291598279db1d4057e217b4256
Closes-Bug: #1336958

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-23 21:56:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/service.py', 'cinder/openstack/common/eventlet_backdoor.py'], 'message': 'Sync oslo service module

This does a full sync of the oslo.service module.  Note
that we've cherry picked some critical bug-fix changes
to this module already, this commit just syncs the full
module properly and gets us up to date where we should be.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
-----------------------
commit:  d5edda00b4eca65d57f94bd0ac1b790e6d1f732e
Date:    Wed Apr 22 19:49:00 2015 +0000
Merge "service child process normal SIGTERM exit"

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------------------
d5edda00 - Merge "service child process normal SIGTERM exit"
702bc569 - service child process normal SIGTERM exit
64b5819e - Revert "Revert "Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses
           in ProcessLauncher
f5646edc - Revert "Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses
           in ProcessLauncher
d23b6589 - Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"
593005b7 - ProcessLauncher: reload config file in parent process on SIGHUP
f29e865d - Store ProcessLauncher signal handlers on class level
bf92010c - Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher

NOTE: Commit 702bc569 was actually pulled in with commit d73ac96d .
      We shouldn't have merged that individual commit.  I include the
      commit here to document Oslo level that the service module is at
      cumulatively between that commit and patch.

Change-Id: I613ba5ba442cf533c0f68d06281d117fbac20bd6
'}]
commit_message:
Sync oslo service module

This does a full sync of the oslo.service module.  Note
that we've cherry picked some critical bug-fix changes
to this module already, this commit just syncs the full
module properly and gets us up to date where we should be.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
-----------------------
commit:  d5edda00b4eca65d57f94bd0ac1b790e6d1f732e
Date:    Wed Apr 22 19:49:00 2015 +0000
Merge "service child process normal SIGTERM exit"

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------------------
d5edda00 - Merge "service child process normal SIGTERM exit"
702bc569 - service child process normal SIGTERM exit
64b5819e - Revert "Revert "Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses
           in ProcessLauncher
f5646edc - Revert "Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses
           in ProcessLauncher
d23b6589 - Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"
593005b7 - ProcessLauncher: reload config file in parent process on SIGHUP
f29e865d - Store ProcessLauncher signal handlers on class level
bf92010c - Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher

NOTE: Commit 702bc569 was actually pulled in with commit d73ac96d .
      We shouldn't have merged that individual commit.  I include the
      commit here to document Oslo level that the service module is at
      cumulatively between that commit and patch.

Change-Id: I613ba5ba442cf533c0f68d06281d117fbac20bd6

commit_message:
Split validation.file_exists, allow `required' arg

Split validation.file_exists into `_file_access_ok' function.
Add validation argument `required' that specifies whether the file name
value is required to be non-None.

Change-Id: Ic86b92364482e7765e55d45b60749f532bbd78e1
Implements: blueprint vm-workloads-framework

commit_message:
Updates for Kilo release

Many small updates to various sections to:
* remove/reword/redirect old pre-icehouse cruft
* update links from Juno to kilo (eg config reference)
* generally improve anything that looked dated

commit_message:
Update ops guide to Kilo release

This patch addresses various sections that referred to releases
Juno and earlier, and removes them or edits them to be up-to-date.

As debian was removed from the install guide this cycle, references
to the debian install guide have also been removed here.

Change-Id: If616c2af0f9e9f79e7c74c37e5f82994bb8b26a2

commit_message:
Modified help display format to present a more user-friendly display

The current -h/--help display uses original cliff format,
the display is unfriendly due to mismatched indent.

This patch replaces the original HelpAction and formatter
imported from cliff with custom ones to present a more
user friendly display. And it is also more similar with
other OpenStack projects' help display.

Change-Id: I28405e4001369614f02ad755c12b138713e6c3b2
Closes-Bug:#1449516
(cherry picked from commit f73760f79757f88ee672dbd35de6443742c9d501)

commit_message:
Delete requirement on unneeded arguments

 * There was a requirement - mistralclient doesn't
 init without user_id or username and project_id or project_name
 However, keystone doesn't need this parameter if token is provided.

Closes-Bug: #1407992

Change-Id: I903d52f2552d6b5e718d13d5957404e0a2d9f9d3
(cherry picked from commit d339608bc1cb271ccabf4f5980c9cfbda3c4f1fb)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-04 08:44:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/floating_ip.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/fixed_ip.py'], 'message': "Fixed incorrect version of FloatingIp object.

In change I34ec32f0b3704b01aaca9c0cb2b34eb6d3107513
Tag and TagList objects were added to the Instance object.
Because of this versions of Instance, BlockDeviceMapping
and FixedIP were updated. But version of FloatingIp wasn't
updated. It should be updated because it depends on FixedIp.

Also in change I4dff5267902362057cc5ee18357539b7192782cb
version of FixedIP object was updated but version
of FloatingIP object wasn't. Because of this we have to
update version of FloatingIP twice.

Change-Id: Icc881c8ef7158055d9287ef744021c1028737ff0
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed incorrect version of FloatingIp object.

In change I34ec32f0b3704b01aaca9c0cb2b34eb6d3107513
Tag and TagList objects were added to the Instance object.
Because of this versions of Instance, BlockDeviceMapping
and FixedIP were updated. But version of FloatingIp wasn't
updated. It should be updated because it depends on FixedIp.

Also in change I4dff5267902362057cc5ee18357539b7192782cb
version of FixedIP object was updated but version
of FloatingIP object wasn't. Because of this we have to
update version of FloatingIP twice.

Change-Id: Icc881c8ef7158055d9287ef744021c1028737ff0

commit_message:
Fixed a problem with incorrect size of storage in Admin/Hypervisors

Since using Ceph for ephemeral storage it adds up the ceph
storage seen in each storage node rather than just using
the real amount of ceph storage.
More information in bug description.

Closes-bug: #1387812

Change-Id: Ie2796a7dce2691213ac4a832fe2e688e8ddc7223

subject: fix git_timed retry logic
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-29 11:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/gerrit-git-prep.sh'], 'message': 'fix git_timed retry logic

git_timed retry logic actually only retried *if* we timed out, not if
the command itself failed, as it would explicitly exit if the return
code was anything except 124. This loops in all failure cases, which
was the intent of the original fix.

Related-Bug: #1282876

Change-Id: I576df4832665beb21992ffa873da28a198018530
'}]
commit_message:
fix git_timed retry logic

git_timed retry logic actually only retried *if* we timed out, not if
the command itself failed, as it would explicitly exit if the return
code was anything except 124. This loops in all failure cases, which
was the intent of the original fix.

Related-Bug: #1282876

Change-Id: I576df4832665beb21992ffa873da28a198018530

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-22 19:21:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Add config option to disable handling virt lifecycle events

Historically the _sync_power_states periodic task has had the potential
for race conditions and several changes have been made to try and
tighten up this code:

cc5388bbe81aba635fb757e202d860aeed98f3e8
aa1792eb4c1d10e9a192142ce7e20d37871d916a
baabab45e0ae0e9e35872cae77eb04bdb5ee0545
bd8329b34098436d18441a8129f3f20af53c2b91

The handle_lifecycle_events method which gets power state change events
from the compute driver (currently only implemented by the libvirt
driver) and calls _sync_instance_power_state - the same method that the
_sync_power_states periodic task uses, except the periodic task at least
locks when it's running - expands the scope for race problems in the
compute manager so cloud providers should be able to turn it off. It is
also known to have races with reboot where rebooted instances are
automatically shutdown because of delayed lifecycle events that the
instance is stopped even though it's running.

This is consistent with the view that Nova should manage it's own state
and not rely on external events telling it what to do about state
changes. For example, in _sync_instance_power_state, if the Nova
database thinks an instance is stopped but the hypervisor says it's
running, the compute manager issues a force-stop on the instance.

Also, although not documented (at least from what I can find), Nova has
historically held a stance that it does not support out-of-band
discovery and management of instances, so allowing external events to
change state somewhat contradicts that stance and should be at least a
configurable deployment option.

DocImpact: New config option "handle_virt_lifecycle_events" in the
           DEFAULT group of nova.conf. By default the value is True
           so there is no upgrade impact or change in functionality.

Related-Bug: #1293480

Partial-Bug: #1444630

Change-Id: I26a1bc70939fb40dc38e9c5c43bf58ed1378bcc7

commit_message:
Add config option to disable handling virt lifecycle events

Historically the _sync_power_states periodic task has had the potential
for race conditions and several changes have been made to try and
tighten up this code:

cc5388bbe81aba635fb757e202d860aeed98f3e8
aa1792eb4c1d10e9a192142ce7e20d37871d916a
baabab45e0ae0e9e35872cae77eb04bdb5ee0545
bd8329b34098436d18441a8129f3f20af53c2b91

The handle_lifecycle_events method which gets power state change events
from the compute driver (currently only implemented by the libvirt
driver) and calls _sync_instance_power_state - the same method that the
_sync_power_states periodic task uses, except the periodic task at least
locks when it's running - expands the scope for race problems in the
compute manager so cloud providers should be able to turn it off. It is
also known to have races with reboot where rebooted instances are
automatically shutdown because of delayed lifecycle events that the
instance is stopped even though it's running.

This is consistent with the view that Nova should manage it's own state
and not rely on external events telling it what to do about state
changes. For example, in _sync_instance_power_state, if the Nova
database thinks an instance is stopped but the hypervisor says it's
running, the compute manager issues a force-stop on the instance.

Also, although not documented (at least from what I can find), Nova has
historically held a stance that it does not support out-of-band
discovery and management of instances, so allowing external events to
change state somewhat contradicts that stance and should be at least a
configurable deployment option.

DocImpact: New config option "handle_virt_lifecycle_events" in the
           DEFAULT group of nova.conf. By default the value is True
           so there is no upgrade impact or change in functionality.

Related-Bug: #1293480
Partial-Bug: #1443186
Partial-Bug: #1444630

Change-Id: I26a1bc70939fb40dc38e9c5c43bf58ed1378bcc7

subject: add convenience tools
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-04-24 15:59:25.000000000', 'files': ['run_resource.sh', 'cache_git.sh'], 'message': "add convenience tools

The following are some convenience tools that I created during grenade
refactor which might make sense in the tree. These make working on grenade
much easier.

cache_git.sh builds a local git mirror so you can set
GIT_BASE=/opt/git and iterate faster.

run_resource.sh <project> <phase> - lets you run resource test scripts
the way we'll run them in grenade for iterative development.

Both scripts include help with '-h' on their usage.

Change-Id: I997c3bfee09dab93ecaa52dd9b86d7811c63bfa3
"}]
commit_message:
add convenience tools

The following are some convenience tools that I created during grenade
refactor which might make sense in the tree. These make working on grenade
much easier.

cache_git.sh builds a local git mirror so you can set
GIT_BASE=/opt/git and iterate faster.

run_resource.sh <project> <phase> - lets you run resource test scripts
the way we'll run them in grenade for iterative development.

Both scripts include help with '-h' on their usage.

Change-Id: I997c3bfee09dab93ecaa52dd9b86d7811c63bfa3

The current -h/--help display uses original cliff format,
the display is unfriendly due to mismatched indent.

commit_message:
Modified help display format to present a more user-friendly display

The current -h/--help display uses original cliff format,
the display is unfriendly due to mismatched indent.

This patch replaces the original HelpAction and formatter
imported from cliff with custom ones to present a more
user friendly display. And it is also more similar with
other OpenStack projects' help display.

Change-Id: I28405e4001369614f02ad755c12b138713e6c3b2
Closes-Bug:#1449516

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 19:02:14.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/filesystem.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I1fd9eba88ec8d436f6d2e37df851dbaa84a8c78c
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I1fd9eba88ec8d436f6d2e37df851dbaa84a8c78c

commit_message:
Delete requirement on unneeded arguments

 * There was a requirement - mistralclient doesn't
 init without user_id or username and project_id or project_name
 However, keystone doesn't need this parameter if token is provided.

Closes-Bug: #1407992

Change-Id: I903d52f2552d6b5e718d13d5957404e0a2d9f9d3

commit_message:
Adding script for retrieving OpenStack action list

 * It is simple CLI tool.
 * Script now works fine for: Nova, Keystone,
   Glance, Heat and Cinder.
 * in case of Keystone, user must provide full
   auth_info and use v3 auth_url.

TODO:
 * Think on optimal way to do it for neutron.

Change-Id: I3ed144bd84a6fbd24dc518c17cd3962bf3af4caa

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 14:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/preseed/ubuntu-1204.preseed.erb', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/preseed/ubuntu-1404.preseed.erb'], 'message': "Fix syntax error in apt.conf.d/03force-ipv4

Since Idc40f2ccf9fb8494b9b30c58775b38d9487ddcd4 we have a regression, so
native ubuntu provisioning (debian installer) isn't working properly and
after provisioning the nodes are hanged and unable to boot.

That's happened due to syntax error in apt configuration so apt fails to
install grub and other packages.

Closes-Bug: #1447696

Change-Id: I290717e264503c13b0d62bad21d57f89482396d3
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix syntax error in apt.conf.d/03force-ipv4

Since Idc40f2ccf9fb8494b9b30c58775b38d9487ddcd4 we have a regression, so
native ubuntu provisioning (debian installer) isn't working properly and
after provisioning the nodes are hanged and unable to boot.

That's happened due to syntax error in apt configuration so apt fails to
install grub and other packages.

Closes-Bug: #1447696

Change-Id: I290717e264503c13b0d62bad21d57f89482396d3
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

subject: project-config: Merge lint jobs (2/2)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-23 18:15:57.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'project-config: Merge lint jobs (2/2)

Since both pep8 and bashate are voting, we can merge the two lint
targets into the "common" pep8 lint target. There's no need for a
separate bashate run.

This change is the second part for this.
Since the jobs are changed, we can now remove the obsolete bashate
tox.ini target.

Change-Id: I572ba3fe8b3a9a05f5239a858d2f701bfd8f684d
'}]
commit_message:
project-config: Merge lint jobs (2/2)

Since both pep8 and bashate are voting, we can merge the two lint
targets into the "common" pep8 lint target. There's no need for a
separate bashate run.

This change is the second part for this.
Since the jobs are changed, we can now remove the obsolete bashate
tox.ini target.

Change-Id: I572ba3fe8b3a9a05f5239a858d2f701bfd8f684d

commit_message:
Add `LogCatcher' context manager

Add `LogCatcher' context manager that records all the log messages
issued by the code inside the context. User can then check if there
is a message with the particular content or simply retrieve all
 messages.

Change-Id: If0bb5f3e8f4d8a61aa3639340b2c8a4250cb3153
Closes-Bug: #1449009

commit_message:
Add keystoneauth library and testing infrastructure

Add the keystoneauth library and testing. This is meant to split out the
auth-specifics from keystoneclient and made as lightweight as possible.
This is the initial split, cleanup and trimming down will be handled in
gerrit.

subject: ceilometer: Use http session in dispatcher
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-28 10:44:24.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/ceilometer/dispatcher.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_ceilometer_dispatcher.py'], 'message': 'ceilometer: Use http session in dispatcher

The ceilometer dipatcher needs to do between 2 to 5 http requests
for each samples. Current it use the basic API of the python-requests
library, that creates 1 tcp connections for each http requests.
Connections are pooled by default (10 simultaneous connections) and
a error is raised when the pool is exhausted.

This change move to the session API of python-requests to
creates only one tcp connection per ceilometer-collector workers,
and block when the pool exhausts.

Change-Id: I8255622cf57082785b48754d9e506413ee9122a7
'}]
commit_message:
ceilometer: Use http session in dispatcher

The ceilometer dipatcher needs to do between 2 to 5 http requests
for each samples. Current it use the basic API of the python-requests
library, that creates 1 tcp connections for each http requests.
Connections are pooled by default (10 simultaneous connections) and
a error is raised when the pool is exhausted.

This change move to the session API of python-requests to
creates only one tcp connection per ceilometer-collector workers,
and block when the pool exhausts.

Change-Id: I8255622cf57082785b48754d9e506413ee9122a7

commit_message:
Add FIP/SNAT using legacy network controller.

This patch uses the L3NatAgent in no-dvr mode to implement the FIP/NAT.
The L3ControllerAgent class extends the L3NatAgent and only synchronize the data to the SDN controller.

Closes-Bug: #1438065
Closes-Bug: #1438523
Change-Id: If74c08629857a2fc71b30ff879cd2787398b9cc5

commit_message:
Streamline and simplify package filtering api

Introduce catalogue parameter to allow distinguishing between catalogue
of applications (packages that one can deploy) and managable-apps
(packages that one can edit).
Streamline include_disabled filtering.
Allow filtering out your own packages for admin requests.

Change-Id: Ica031058d963246ff4d76e52cfc8b8b44d207c9a
Partial-Bug: #1448226
Relates-Bug: #1448135

commit_message:
Show 'reserved' status in os-fixed-ips API

Show the 'reserved' status on a FixedIP object in the os-fixed-ips API
extension. The extension allows one to reserve and unreserve a fixed IP
but the show method does not report the current status.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint show-reserved-status-in-os-fixed-ips-api

Change-Id: Idb0d74414ecbc732b9548bcb103072be80432af9

commit_message:
Ceph: use the admin port for communication with Keystone

Current port, 5000, is meant to be used for public requests. 35357
should be used instead.

Reference: http://ceph.com/docs/master/radosgw/keystone/

Change-Id: I1ef8030b39256a17ef3b1dc1e1061c756d7392a6
Closes-Bug: 1446704

commit_message:
Load archive_policy named resource metric

If the orm object of a metric is loaded with a resource,
the joinedload of the resource doesn't include the archive_policy.

This change load the archive_policy when we ask for a metric attached
to a resource.

Closes-bug: #1449452
Change-Id: Ic48f43048fe3e14b42b347cf44250183de60f9d8

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-28 16:44:37.000000000', 'files': ['packages/deb/module.mk', 'mirror/ubuntu/module.mk'], 'message': "Fixed errors in packages/deb and mirror/ubuntu

1) unconditional rebuilding due to
never existent file

repocleanup.done used to depend on PHONY target (sources)
which led to unconditional rebuilding.
This didn't influence ISO builds because CI always cleans
environment.

2) fail when try to rebuild second
time without cleaning environment

repo.done used to consume some config files
created by reprepro.done target. After consuming those files
it used to remove them not touching reprepro.done itself.
Without cleaning build environment this fails the build process.

Change-Id: Ib0de2e5ea94caeb7f93f5bc8d0f06a6f806e3ca6
Closes-Bug: #1448206
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed errors in packages/deb and mirror/ubuntu

1) unconditional rebuilding due to
never existent file

repocleanup.done used to depend on PHONY target (sources)
which led to unconditional rebuilding.
This didn't influence ISO builds because CI always cleans
environment.

2) fail when try to rebuild second
time without cleaning environment

repo.done used to consume some config files
created by reprepro.done target. After consuming those files
it used to remove them not touching reprepro.done itself.
Without cleaning build environment this fails the build process.

Change-Id: Ib0de2e5ea94caeb7f93f5bc8d0f06a6f806e3ca6
Closes-Bug: #1448206

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I975592f3694be42d52685ebf606f6d3012caf1a8

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-21 07:50:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Don't query compute_node through service object in nova-manage

The relationship between compute_node and service tables was
removed in a recent commit and to be able to remove compat code in
the objects, calls to get them should be done directly instead of
going through one or the other.

Since we are really just interested in the compute_node object here
this in addition saves us one extra db call.

Change-Id: I5270882321f7d16f993746498f751f17b0cb52fd
Related-Bug: #1438189
"}]
commit_message:
Don't query compute_node through service object in nova-manage

The relationship between compute_node and service tables was
removed in a recent commit and to be able to remove compat code in
the objects, calls to get them should be done directly instead of
going through one or the other.

Since we are really just interested in the compute_node object here
this in addition saves us one extra db call.

Change-Id: I5270882321f7d16f993746498f751f17b0cb52fd
Related-Bug: #1438189

commit_message:
[report] Improve reports data and units

- Adds new median metric both on CLI and HTML reports.
- Adds supports for table header that consolidates
  units from each metric, and gives a title.
- Re-organizes metrics based on order statistics
  (min, percentiles, max) then its followed by
  aggregate statistics metrics.
- Includes unit tests.

Change-Id: Icd154c9f00b5e9d6df11797685fe8f92c4fdbb1b

Add system test for DualHypervisors mode with vCenter Glance

5. Deploy the cluster
6. Run network verification
7. Run OSTF

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-28 15:55:40.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/task/task.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_verify_networks_task_manager.py'], 'message': 'Consider whether nodes have public network for net-checker config

Public VLANs should be added into net-checker configuration only
for nodes which have br-ex to be configured and only when cluster have
more than one of such nodes.
When there is only one such node in cluster, public VLAN cannot be checked

Change-Id: I4bb17d6f2f797b90a045cb953922518e4d0bfe85
'}]
commit_message:
Consider whether nodes have public network for net-checker config

Public VLANs should be added into net-checker configuration only
for nodes which have br-ex to be configured and only when cluster have
more than one of such nodes.
When there is only one such node in cluster, public VLAN cannot be checked
as there is no sense to run data transmission test within one node.

Closes-Bug: #1397369
Change-Id: I4bb17d6f2f797b90a045cb953922518e4d0bfe85

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 22:18:57.000000000', 'files': ['os_doc_tools/openstack/common/log.py', 'os_doc_tools/doctest.py', 'autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py', 'autogenerate_config_docs/hooks.py', 'autogenerate_config_docs/test/generator.py', 'autogenerate_config_docs/extract_swift_flags.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ib17a74ada3122ce45c52fdd7dcf8d27fafbb1d70
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ib17a74ada3122ce45c52fdd7dcf8d27fafbb1d70

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-05 14:04:31.000000000', 'files': ['packages/rpm/specs/fuel-agent.spec'], 'message': "IBP: Add python-urllib3 to fuel-agent rpm spec

In order to handle network errors correctly, python-urllib3 package
should be added to dependencies.

Fuel-agent relies on a recent version of python-requests (1.2.3),
which's known for raising exceptions from urllib3 library.

Partially implements: blueprint ibp-reconnect

Related-Bug: #1389120
Change-Id: I29495e03c3ad7c2697d554265b1b9c299187d875
"}]
commit_message:
IBP: Add python-urllib3 to fuel-agent rpm spec

In order to handle network errors correctly, python-urllib3 package
should be added to dependencies.

Fuel-agent relies on a recent version of python-requests (1.2.3),
which's known for raising exceptions from urllib3 library.

Partially implements: blueprint ibp-reconnect

Related-Bug: #1389120
Change-Id: I29495e03c3ad7c2697d554265b1b9c299187d875

commit_message:
[install-guide] add 127.0.0.1 to the bind_ip parameter of MongoDB

If monogd is not listening on 127.0.0.1 there are issues when calling
the mongo command with an '127.0.0.1 controller' entry in the
/etc/hosts file.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.

Change-Id: Ia07fb6689841cbb3763de507602244fabd2b256d

commit_message:
Replace cluster size with new property desired_capacity

This patch removed the *size* property of cluster since we can
always get this vlaue by counting the length of cluster nodes
list. At the same time, this patch added a new property
*desired_capacity* which represents the goal of all cluster
operations(e.g. creating, scaling).

Implements: blueprint replace-cluster-size-with-desired-capacity
Change-Id: I50d1a946c19c86d9424546ccad48ca65acf146a0

subject: Improve strictness of DRAC test cases error checking
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-28 09:47:28.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/drac/test_power.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/drac/test_management.py'], 'message': "Improve strictness of DRAC test cases error checking

The 'spec_set' option of Mock object directs stricter checking than
'spec' option.
The commit 926a6d2521de5cad2221e4acade7b4af2eb37dc0 assigned
'spec_set' to the external functions of PYWSMAN, but it assigned
'spec' to the internal functions.
This patch makes strictness of the error checking consistent among
DRAC test cases.

Change-Id: I96eba89b3360668afa628a8ac0880c866bec7e5c
"}]
commit_message:
Improve strictness of DRAC test cases error checking

The 'spec_set' option of Mock object directs stricter checking than
'spec' option.
The commit 926a6d2521de5cad2221e4acade7b4af2eb37dc0 assigned
'spec_set' to the external functions of PYWSMAN, but it assigned
'spec' to the internal functions.
This patch makes strictness of the error checking consistent among
DRAC test cases.

Change-Id: I96eba89b3360668afa628a8ac0880c866bec7e5c

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-28 16:34:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Virt: update shared storage log information message

The shared storage base methods in
commit 52f6981aa35e27c48587ad2320891db8364edd02 raised NotImplemented.
This led to the following warning:
'Hypervisor driver does not support instance shared storage check,
 assuming it's not on shared storage'

This log message has been changed to a debug message.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib6c5fabe2d3a4e17d322d00887b8e4b294541fca
"}]
commit_message:
Virt: update shared storage log information message

The shared storage base methods in
commit 52f6981aa35e27c48587ad2320891db8364edd02 raised NotImplemented.
This led to the following warning:
'Hypervisor driver does not support instance shared storage check,
 assuming it's not on shared storage'

This log message has been changed to a debug message.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib6c5fabe2d3a4e17d322d00887b8e4b294541fca
